translated: They are as follows:

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'i las kyi 'khor lo rnam par gzhag pa dang / kha ton goms par bya ba'i las kyi 'khor lo rnam par bzhag pa dang / bsod nams bya ba'i las kyi 'khor lo rnam par bzhag pa dang gsum mo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'i las kyi 'khor lo rnam par gzhag pa dang / kha ton goms par bya ba'i las kyi 'khor lo rnam par bzhag pa dang / bsod nams bya ba'i las kyi 'khor lo rnam par bzhag pa dang gsum mo //
translated: the wheel of karma of cultivating samādhi, the wheel of karma of familiarizing oneself with recitation, and the wheel of karma of performing meritorious deeds.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de la ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'i las kyi 'khor lo gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'i las kyi 'khor lo gang zhe na /
translated: what is the wheel of karma of cultivating the samādhi of the tathāgatas?

original: ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: It is the ten types of samādhi.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus 'di la brtags na yul drug dang / bdag dang / bdag gir zhen cing chags pa'i rgyu dang / las kyi zhing dang / ma rig pas bsgribs pa dang / sred pa'i chus brlan pa'i dbang med par gzhan gyi dbang gis yod par gyur pas rkyen mang po la rag las pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus 'di la brtags na yul drug dang / bdag dang / bdag gir zhen cing chags pa'i rgyu dang / las kyi zhing dang / ma rig pas bsgribs pa dang / sred pa'i chus brlan pa'i dbang med par gzhan gyi dbang gis yod par gyur pas rkyen mang po la rag las pa'o //
translated: When this body is examined in reality, as it is, it is found to be dependent on many conditions, because it exists through the power of something else, being powerless itself, moistened by the water of craving, obscured by the darkness of ignorance, and the field of karma, the cause of attachment and clinging to the six sense objects and to self and possessions.

original: las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyun rnam pa gsum po dgag pa'i phyir de ltar brtag go /
analyzed: las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyun rnam pa gsum po dgag pa'i phyir de ltar brtag go /
translated: One should examine it in this way in order to stop the three kinds of continuity: the continuity of karma, the continuity of the afflictions, and the continuity of suffering.

original: las kyi rgyun gang zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi rgyun gang zhe na /
translated: What is the continuity of karma?

original: gang sems can rnams ji snyed kyi 'du byed mngon du spyod pa de ma rig pa dang / sred pa'i rgyu las srid pa skye bas nyon mongs pa'i rgyun ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang sems can rnams ji snyed kyi 'du byed mngon du spyod pa de ma rig pa dang / sred pa'i rgyu las srid pa skye bas nyon mongs pa'i rgyun ces bya'o //
translated: It is the activity of the formations of all sentient beings, which is called the continuity of the afflictions because existence arises from the cause of ignorance and craving.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa'i rgyu dang / rkyen mang po 'dus pa las ming dang / gzugs skye'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa'i rgyu dang / rkyen mang po 'dus pa las ming dang / gzugs skye'o //
translated: Due to the power of the afflictions, name-and-form arise from the coming together of many causes and conditions of consciousness.

original: ming dang / gzugs kyi rgyu dang / rkyen mang po 'dus pa las skye mched drug skye'o //
analyzed: ming dang / gzugs kyi rgyu dang / rkyen mang po 'dus pa las skye mched drug skye'o //
translated: From the coming together of many causes and conditions of name-and-form, the six sense spheres arise.

original: skye mched drug gi rgyu dang / rkyen mang po 'dus @190b pa las reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / srid pa phyi ma'i skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba la sog pa rim kyis 'byung ba na sdug bsngal gyi rgyun ces bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rgyu dang / rkyen mang po 'dus @190b pa las reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / srid pa phyi ma'i skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba la sog pa rim kyis 'byung ba na sdug bsngal gyi rgyun ces bya'o //
translated: From the coming together of many causes and conditions of the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, craving, appropriation, existence, birth, and the aging and death of future lives arise in sequence. This is called the continuum of suffering.

original: da ltar rgyun gsum po 'di ni las kyi zhing la ma rig pa'i rgyu dang / sred pa'i rlan gyis skye bar gyur to //
analyzed: da ltar rgyun gsum po 'di ni las kyi zhing la ma rig pa'i rgyu dang / sred pa'i rlan gyis skye bar gyur to //
translated: This present continuum of three is born in the field of karma through the cause of ignorance and the moisture of craving.

original: 'di ltar las kyi zhing lam rig pa'i rgyu dang / sred pa'i rlan gyis rgyun rnam pa gsum po brkam pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / bems po dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar las kyi zhing lam rig pa'i rgyu dang / sred pa'i rlan gyis rgyun rnam pa gsum po brkam pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / bems po dang /
translated: suffering, devoid of self, inanimate,

original: g-yo ba med pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu ba lta bu dang / chu'i zla ba lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu stong pa ci'ang med pa /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu ba lta bu dang / chu'i zla ba lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bu stong pa ci'ang med pa /
translated: motionless, like an illusion, like a mirage, like the moon in water, and like a dream—empty,

original: mtshan ma med pa /🔽smon pa med pa /🔽byas pa med pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa / smon pa med pa / byas pa med pa /
translated: signless,🔽wishless,🔽uncreated,

original: ma byung ba /
analyzed: ma byung ba /
translated: unoriginated,

original: ma skyes pa /
analyzed: ma skyes pa /
translated: unborn,

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: formless,🔽peaceful,🔽isolated,🔽unoriginated, and without a basis for origination.

original: zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / ma byung ba dang / skye ba'i gnas med par rtogs so; ;de ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la shin tu brtags pas stong pa nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / ma byung ba dang / skye ba'i gnas med par rtogs so; ;de ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la shin tu brtags pas stong pa nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: In this way, by thoroughly investigating the five appropriated aggregates, one will realize the acceptance that accords with emptiness, the acceptance that accords with signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa la phyogs so //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa la phyogs so //
translated: He is in accord with the acceptance that is in accord with the absence of expectancy.

original: yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la rjes su brtag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la rjes su brtag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to investigate the five appropriated aggregates,

original: gzhan yang / thabs mkhas pas dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la rtog ste nang du rgyu ba dang / phyir rgyu ba'i dran pa goms par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang / thabs mkhas pas dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la rtog ste nang du rgyu ba dang / phyir rgyu ba'i dran pa goms par byed do //
translated: he is skilled in the method of investigating the inhalation and exhalation of the breath, and he cultivates the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: de la ji ltar na dran pa'i dbang gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la rtog ce na /🔽yang dag pa ji lta @191a *//
analyzed: de la ji ltar na dran pa'i dbang gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la rtog ce na / yang dag pa ji lta @191a *//
translated: How does he, through the power of mindfulness, investigate the inhalation and exhalation of the breath as it really is?

original: ba bzhin du bgrang ba dang / rjes su 'brang ba dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / 'jug pa dang / yongs su dag pa la rtog go /
analyzed: ba bzhin du bgrang ba dang / rjes su 'brang ba dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / 'jug pa dang / yongs su dag pa la rtog go /
translated: He investigates the inhalation and exhalation of the breath as it really is in terms of counting, following, calming, insight, application, and purification.

original: de la bgrang bas ni las kyi dngos po rnam pa gnyis byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la bgrang bas ni las kyi dngos po rnam pa gnyis byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Through counting, he performs the two types of activities.

original: rten du gyur pas rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa rnams thul ba dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin par nus pa'o //
analyzed: rten du gyur pas rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa rnams thul ba dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin par nus pa'o //
translated: It is the basis for subduing discursive thought and investigation, and for being able to hold the characteristics of the in- and out-breaths.

original: rjes su 'brang bas kyang las kyi dngos po rnam pa gnyis byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang bas kyang las kyi dngos po rnam pa gnyis byed par 'gyur te /
translated: The pursuit also performs two kinds of functions:

original: yang dag par 'byung ba la rten cing rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang bral ba dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'byung ba la rten cing rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang bral ba dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par gyur pa'o //
translated: it is the basis for the arising of the path, and it is the basis for being free from discursive thought and investigation, and for being skilled in the characteristics of the engagement of the in- and out-breaths.

original: zhi gnas kyis kyang las kyi dngos po rnam pa gnyis byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyis kyang las kyi dngos po rnam pa gnyis byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Tranquility also performs two kinds of functions:

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba bri bar mngon du ston pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mchog la gnas par nus pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba bri bar mngon du ston pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mchog la gnas par nus pa'o //
translated: it is the basis for the manifestation of the decrease of the in- and out-breaths, and it is the basis for being able to abide in the highest meditative concentration.

original: lhag mthong gis kyang las kyi dngos po rnam pa gnyis byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhag mthong gis kyang las kyi dngos po rnam pa gnyis byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Insight also performs two kinds of functions:

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba zad par mngon du ston pa dang / sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos so sor rtogs pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba zad par mngon du ston pa dang / sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos so sor rtogs pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: It manifests the cessation of the in-and-out breathing, and it is the basis for the discernment of mind and mental activities.

original: 'jug pas kyang las kyi dngos po rnam pa gnyis byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jug pas kyang las kyi dngos po rnam pa gnyis byed par 'gyur te /
translated: It also performs two kinds of actions through its engagement:

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po spong ba'i sbyor ba la mkhas pa dang / 'phags pa'i sar 'jug pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po spong ba'i sbyor ba la mkhas pa dang / 'phags pa'i sar 'jug pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: it is skilled in the application for abandoning the appropriated aggregates, and it is the application for entering the stages of the noble ones.

original: yongs su dag pas kyang bya ba'i @191b las kyi dngos po gnyis byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pas kyang bya ba'i @191b las kyi dngos po gnyis byed par 'gyur te /
translated: It also performs two kinds of actions through its purification:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / lta ba yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / lta ba yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: it abandons the afflictions and it purifies views.

original: de ltar sbyor ba rnam pa drug gis dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la rtog pa bsgoms pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun par 'jug go /
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba rnam pa drug gis dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la rtog pa bsgoms pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun par 'jug go /
translated: Thus, through these six kinds of application, the cultivation of the contemplation of the in-and-out breathing is in accord with the realization of the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ji ltar dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i rang bzhin ni gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i rang bzhin ni gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The nature of the inhalation and exhalation of breath is the aggregate of grasping form.

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba len cing myong bar byed pa ni tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba len cing myong bar byed pa ni tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The experience of the inhalation and exhalation of breath is the aggregate of grasping feeling.🔽The grasping of the characteristics of the inhalation and exhalation of breath is the aggregate of grasping perception.

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid len pa ni 'du shes nye bar len pa'i phung po'o; ;dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba mngon du byed pa ni 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid len pa ni 'du shes nye bar len pa'i phung po'o; ;dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba mngon du byed pa ni 'du byed nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The manifestation of the inhalation and exhalation of breath is the aggregate of grasping volitional factors.

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba bye brag tu 'byed pa ni rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po ste /
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba bye brag tu 'byed pa ni rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po ste /
translated: The differentiation of the inhalation and exhalation of breath is the aggregate of grasping consciousness.

original: de ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po rnam lnga bshad pa ni so so ba /🔽tha dad pa /
analyzed: de ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po rnam lnga bshad pa ni so so ba / tha dad pa /
translated: “Thus, the explanation of the five aggregates of grasping is individual,🔽separate,

original: mi 'dra ba /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba /
translated: different,

original: gsar ma yin pa /
analyzed: gsar ma yin pa /
translated: not new,

original: rnying ma yin pa /
analyzed: rnying ma yin pa /
translated: not old,

original: gnas med pa /
analyzed: gnas med pa /
translated: not a location,

original: spungs pa med pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: spungs pa med pa ma yin pa /
translated: not a heap,

original: brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'o //
translated: and inexpressible.”

original: de ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga shin tu rtogs pas 'du byed rnam pa gsum yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga shin tu rtogs pas 'du byed rnam pa gsum yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by thoroughly understanding the five appropriated aggregates, one abandons the three kinds of conditioning.

original: gal te de lta 'du byed rnam pa gsum yongs su zad par rjes su brtags pa'i mthar phyin na rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus dang / yul drug rjes su rtogs pa'i mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta 'du byed rnam pa gsum yongs su zad par rjes su brtags pa'i mthar phyin na rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus dang / yul drug rjes su rtogs pa'i mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one thoroughly investigates the exhaustion of the three kinds of conditioning, one will reach the end of the body with consciousness and the six sense objects.

original: bdag dang / bdag gir zhen @192a *//
analyzed: bdag dang / bdag gir zhen @192a *//
translated: One will reach the end of the attachment to self and entities connected to the self,

original: pa dang / las dang / ma rig pa dang / srid pa'i rgyu dang / zhing dang / kun nas 'gebs pa'i rlon pa'ang thams cad zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa dang / las dang / ma rig pa dang / srid pa'i rgyu dang / zhing dang / kun nas 'gebs pa'i rlon pa'ang thams cad zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: the causes of karma, ignorance, and existence, and the wet covering of the field will all be exhausted.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa'ang yongs su rdzogs pa nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du'ang bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa'ang yongs su rdzogs pa nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du'ang bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the cultivation of the four establishments of mindfulness will be perfected, up to the cultivation of the eightfold noble path will be perfected.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du'ang bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du'ang bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, the cultivation is perfected.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa dang / dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i bar du bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa dang / dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i bar du bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, up to the knowledge of all modes, the acquiescence in the non-production of things, the heroic progress concentration, etc., the cultivation is perfected.

original: de bzhin du 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba rjes su dran pas gzung bar bsam gtan dag la zhugs pa ni yang dag pa'i chos don dam pa la gnas pa'i sems can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba rjes su dran pas gzung bar bsam gtan dag la zhugs pa ni yang dag pa'i chos don dam pa la gnas pa'i sems can zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the one who has entered the trances by the retention of the recollection of going and coming is called the one who has the highest aim, the true Dharma.

original: bsam gtan yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the one who cultivates the trances in accordance with reality.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la yang dag par mchod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la yang dag par mchod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the one who makes true offerings to the Buddhas of the three times.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs las byung ba'i sras /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs las byung ba'i sras /
translated: He is called the son born from the heart of all the Buddhas.

original: thams cad kyi gsung las skyes pa; chos kyi grub pas chos kyi btul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi gsung las skyes pa; chos kyi grub pas chos kyi btul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the one who is born from the speech of all buddhas, the one who is tamed by the Dharma through the accomplishment of the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la las de ltar bsgoms pa las bags kyis phyir nur na'ang zag pa zad pa'i dgra bcom par @192b gyur pa nas mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la las de ltar bsgoms pa las bags kyis phyir nur na'ang zag pa zad pa'i dgra bcom par @192b gyur pa nas mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Some bodhisattvas, though they regress from such meditation, become arhats with the extinction of defilements and attain the six supernormal knowledges.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la la de ltar bsgoms pas gong nas gong du 'phar ba ni yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la la de ltar bsgoms pas gong nas gong du 'phar ba ni yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs te /
translated: “Some bodhisattvas, through such meditation, progress higher and higher and perfect all good qualities.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen por gyur pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen por gyur pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: They become bodhisattva-mahāsattvas and perfect the eighteen distinctive abilities of buddhas up to omniscient wisdom.

original: ring po mi thogs par bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ring po mi thogs par bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will soon attain supreme awakening and perfect buddhahood.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: ngas rnam pa de snyed kyi las dang / chos dang / tshor ba dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa la ye shes kyis dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi chos la brtags na sems can dag ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'i las kyi 'khor lo bcu rnam par bzhag la sgom du 'dzud do //
analyzed: ngas rnam pa de snyed kyi las dang / chos dang / tshor ba dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa la ye shes kyis dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi chos la brtags na sems can dag ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'i las kyi 'khor lo bcu rnam par bzhag la sgom du 'dzud do //
translated: I have examined with my wisdom the Dharma of the buddhas of the three times with regard to the karma of that many aspects, phenomena, feelings, causes, effects, and ripening, and I have established and caused sentient beings to enter the ten wheels of the karma of cultivating samādhi.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom pa'i las kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom pa'i las kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
translated: these are called the tathāgatas’ wheel of the karma of cultivating samādhi.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: de la ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i kha ton goms pa'i las kyi 'khor lo zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i kha ton goms pa'i las kyi 'khor lo zhe na /
translated: what is the tathāgatas’ wheel of the karma of cultivating recitation?

original: gang dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: gang dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: It is when monks, nuns, male and female lay followers, sons and daughters of noble family, or other people who uphold the Dharma, having heard the Dharma from the tathāgatas,

original: rigs kyi bu mo dge ba'i rtsa ba chung zhing srab pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa la gnas pa dbang po yongs su ma smin pa dag la ngas kha ton goms par bya ba la btsud de /🔽srod dang / tho rangs la @193a *//
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo dge ba'i rtsa ba chung zhing srab pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa la gnas pa dbang po yongs su ma smin pa dag la ngas kha ton goms par bya ba la btsud de / srod dang / tho rangs la @193a *//
translated: I have introduced those sons and daughters of good family who have small and thin roots of virtue, who abide in the conventional truth, and whose faculties are not fully ripened, to the practice of reciting.

original: le le med par shin tu brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / sems can gang bla na med pa'i ye shes tshol ba dag ni ngas rnam par dkar pa'i theg pa chen po la btsud de /
analyzed: le le med par shin tu brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / sems can gang bla na med pa'i ye shes tshol ba dag ni ngas rnam par dkar pa'i theg pa chen po la btsud de /
translated: I have introduced those sentient beings who seek unsurpassed wisdom to the Great Vehicle of pure virtue,

original: bdag nyid klog pa dang / pha rol po gzhan klog tu 'jug pa dang / bdag nyid 'don pa dang / pha rol po gzhan 'don du 'jug pa dang / bdag nyid 'chad pa dang / pha rol po gzhan 'chad du 'jug pa dang / theg pa chen po la bdag goms par bya ba dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid klog pa dang / pha rol po gzhan klog tu 'jug pa dang / bdag nyid 'don pa dang / pha rol po gzhan 'don du 'jug pa dang / bdag nyid 'chad pa dang / pha rol po gzhan 'chad du 'jug pa dang / theg pa chen po la bdag goms par bya ba dang /
translated: to the practice of reading themselves and having others read, reciting themselves and having others recite, explaining themselves and having others explain, and familiarizing themselves with the Great Vehicle.

original: pha rol po gzhan goms par byed du 'jug pa dang / bdag dang / gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal ba dang / bla na med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal zhi bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: pha rol po gzhan goms par byed du 'jug pa dang / bdag dang / gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal ba dang / bla na med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal zhi bar bya ba dang /
translated: They strive to cause others to practice, to eliminate their own and others’ defilements, to attain the unsurpassed wisdom of omniscience, to pacify the sufferings of all sentient beings,

original: 'jigs pa med pa'i grong khyer chen por zhugs pa'i phyir rtsol lo //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa'i grong khyer chen por zhugs pa'i phyir rtsol lo //
translated: and to enter the great city of fearlessness.

original: sems can gang rang sangs rgyas kyi thag pa 'dod pa dag ni ngas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos la btsud nas kha ton goms par byed du bcug go /
analyzed: sems can gang rang sangs rgyas kyi thag pa 'dod pa dag ni ngas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos la btsud nas kha ton goms par byed du bcug go /
translated: I have caused those sentient beings who aspire to become pratyekabuddhas to enter the Dharma of dependent origination and to practice recitation.

original: sems can gang nyan thos kyi theg pa 'dod pa dag la ni ngas gzhung tshigs su bcad pa stong phrag brgya pa dang / 'dul ba tshigs su bcad pa stong phrag brgya pa dang / chos mngon pa dang / mngon par smra ba tshigs su bcad pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa kha ton goms par byed du bcug pa de ni /🔽rigs @193b kyi bu /
analyzed: sems can gang nyan thos kyi theg pa 'dod pa dag la ni ngas gzhung tshigs su bcad pa stong phrag brgya pa dang / 'dul ba tshigs su bcad pa stong phrag brgya pa dang / chos mngon pa dang / mngon par smra ba tshigs su bcad pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa kha ton goms par byed du bcug pa de ni / rigs @193b kyi bu /
translated: For those sentient beings who prefer the vehicle of the śrāvakas, I have had them recite the one hundred thousand verses of the scriptures, the one hundred thousand verses of the Vinaya, the one hundred thousand verses of the Abhidharma, the one hundred thousand verses of the Mīmāṃsā, and so forth.🔽“

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i kha ton goms par bya ba'i las kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //🔽rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i kha ton goms par bya ba'i las kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o // rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family, this is called the wheel of the Tathāgata’s activity of recitation.🔽“

original: de la ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i las kyi 'khor lo zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i las kyi 'khor lo zhe na /
translated: Son of noble family, what is the Tathāgata’s wheel of activity of merit?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sems can gang dbang po rtul pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa /
analyzed: sems can gang dbang po rtul pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa /
translated: There are sentient beings with dull faculties who have not planted the roots of virtue,

original: shes rab zhan pa dang / le lo dang bcas pa /
analyzed: shes rab zhan pa dang / le lo dang bcas pa /
translated: who have little wisdom, are lazy,

original: dran pa nyams pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnam ba kun la zhen cing chags pa /
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnam ba kun la zhen cing chags pa /
translated: and have impaired mindfulness. They are attached to all the requisites of life.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su spong ba dag ni ngas bsod nams bya ba'i las la btsud do //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su spong ba dag ni ngas bsod nams bya ba'i las la btsud do //
translated: I have caused those who have abandoned the spiritual friend to engage in meritorious actions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la bya ba byed pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon la bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la bya ba byed pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon la bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: to serve the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha, and to serve the preceptor and the teacher.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsod nams sgrub pa'i las kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsod nams sgrub pa'i las kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the Tathāgata’s wheel of the accumulation of merit.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar nga ni sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo gnyis pa 'di dang ldan te /
analyzed: de ltar nga ni sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo gnyis pa 'di dang ldan te /
translated: I possess this second wheel of the Buddha.

original: 'khor lo de'i dbang gis bla na med pa'i dus gsum gyi las kyi ye shes kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi las dang / chos dang / tshor ba dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu yongs su smin pa mkhyen te /
analyzed: 'khor lo de'i dbang gis bla na med pa'i dus gsum gyi las kyi ye shes kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi las dang / chos dang / tshor ba dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu yongs su smin pa mkhyen te /
translated: By the power of this wheel, with my unsurpassed knowledge of the three times, I know the ripening of the karma, phenomena, and feelings of all sentient beings, as well as their causes and effects, just as they are.

original: cis 'dul ba bzhin du las kyi 'khor lo rnam pa gsum rnam par bzhag nas snod du gyur pa'i sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don dang / 'jigs pa med pa la bde bar bkod do //🔽'jigs pa med pas lha dang / bdud @194a *//
analyzed: cis 'dul ba bzhin du las kyi 'khor lo rnam pa gsum rnam par bzhag nas snod du gyur pa'i sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don dang / 'jigs pa med pa la bde bar bkod do // 'jigs pa med pas lha dang / bdud @194a *//
translated: Having established the three aspects of the wheel of activity in accordance with the means of taming, he benefits all sentient beings who are suitable vessels, and he establishes them in the bliss of fearlessness.

original: du bcas pa'i mu stegs can log par smra ba thams cad btul nas tshangs pa chen po'i 'khor lo bskor zhing /
analyzed: du bcas pa'i mu stegs can log par smra ba thams cad btul nas tshangs pa chen po'i 'khor lo bskor zhing /
translated: Having tamed all the non-Buddhist extremists and false teachers, including the gods and Māra, he turns the wheel of the great Brahmā.

original: tshangs pa chen po'i spyad pa yongs su grub pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi rgyu dang / 'bras bu kun mngon par mkhyen to //
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po'i spyad pa yongs su grub pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi rgyu dang / 'bras bu kun mngon par mkhyen to //
translated: Having perfected the conduct of the great Brahmā, he fully knows the causes and effects of sentient beings just as they are.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: rgyal rigs rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po chen po ni thabs mkhas pa'i blo dang ldan pas dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs la sogs pa yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs dang /
analyzed: rgyal rigs rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po chen po ni thabs mkhas pa'i blo dang ldan pas dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs la sogs pa yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs dang /
translated: They honor and respect those who possess various good qualities, such as ascetics, brahmins, and people of the warrior, merchant, and common classes.🔽They honor and respect those who are learned, heroes, artisans, and strong people.

original: mang du thos pa dang / dpa' bo dang / bzo po dang / rtsal che ba dang / sems can gang phyug cing yon tan dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mang du thos pa dang / dpa' bo dang / bzo po dang / rtsal che ba dang / sems can gang phyug cing yon tan dang ldan pa /
translated: They honor and respect those beings who are wealthy and endowed with good qualities.

original: thabs mkhas pa'i blo dang ldan pa /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa'i blo dang ldan pa /
translated: They honor and respect those who are endowed with the intelligence of skillful means.

original: dpa' zhing rtul phod pa /
analyzed: dpa' zhing rtul phod pa /
translated: They honor and respect those who are brave and courageous.

original: brtan pa phyir mi ldog pa /
analyzed: brtan pa phyir mi ldog pa /
translated: They honor and respect those who are steadfast and irreversible.🔽They honor and respect those who are adorned with various kinds of merit.

original: bsod nams rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su brgyan pa de dag la rgyal rigs rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po chen pos de dag ci dang ldan pa bzhin ci 'os ci rigs su rin po che dang / nor gyi dpyig dang /
analyzed: bsod nams rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su brgyan pa de dag la rgyal rigs rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po chen pos de dag ci dang ldan pa bzhin ci 'os ci rigs su rin po che dang / nor gyi dpyig dang /
translated: “Great kings of the warrior class who have been consecrated on the crown of their heads with the water of the royal consecration give to those who possess such qualities whatever is appropriate and suitable, such as precious jewels,

original: zhing 'brog dang / khang khyim dang / bran dang / las byed pa'i mi la sogs pa ci rigs su sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: zhing 'brog dang / khang khyim dang / bran dang / las byed pa'i mi la sogs pa ci rigs su sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives away fields, pastures, houses, servants, and workers as appropriate.

original: yul de na gnas pa'i mi yon tan dang / shes pa zhan pa /
analyzed: yul de na gnas pa'i mi yon tan dang / shes pa zhan pa /
translated: To those people living in his realm who are of little learning and understanding,

original: las byas pa chung pa dag la ni rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur @194b ba'i rgyal po chen pos de dag la'ang ci 'os ci rigs su shas kyis sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: las byas pa chung pa dag la ni rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur @194b ba'i rgyal po chen pos de dag la'ang ci 'os ci rigs su shas kyis sbyin par byed do //
translated: who have done little work, the great king who has been consecrated on the crown of the head gives them what is appropriate and fitting.

original: yul de na gnas pa bsod nams med cing brtson 'grus chung ba /
analyzed: yul de na gnas pa bsod nams med cing brtson 'grus chung ba /
translated: To those living in his realm who are without merit, who have little perseverance,

original: le lo che ba /
analyzed: le lo che ba /
translated: who are very lazy,

original: bag med pa /
analyzed: bag med pa /
translated: who are heedless,

original: dran pa nyams pa; snying rje'i sems med pa /
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa; snying rje'i sems med pa /
translated: who have lost their mindfulness, who are without a compassionate mind,

original: byas pa mi gzo pa /
analyzed: byas pa mi gzo pa /
translated: who are ungrateful,

original: 'jig rten phyi ma'i sdug bsngal la 'jigs par mi lta ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten phyi ma'i sdug bsngal la 'jigs par mi lta ba /
translated: who do not fear the suffering of the next world,

original: khyim gyi 'dam du bying ba /
analyzed: khyim gyi 'dam du bying ba /
translated: who are sunk in the mud of the household life,

original: sdig pa mang po byed pa de dag la ni rgyal po chen pos ci rigs ci 'os su chad pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gcod de /
analyzed: sdig pa mang po byed pa de dag la ni rgyal po chen pos ci rigs ci 'os su chad pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gcod de /
translated: who commit many sins, the great king cuts them down with various punishments as is appropriate and fitting.

original: kha cig la ni tshig na bas spyos zhing brgyad pa dag byed do //
analyzed: kha cig la ni tshig na bas spyos zhing brgyad pa dag byed do //
translated: Some he punishes with words, some he punishes with whips,

original: kha cig la ni rin po che dang / nor rdzas la sogs pa 'phrog go /
analyzed: kha cig la ni rin po che dang / nor rdzas la sogs pa 'phrog go /
translated: some he punishes by confiscating their jewels, wealth, and so on,

original: kha cig la ni 'tsho ba'i yo byad dag kyang 'phrog go /
analyzed: kha cig la ni 'tsho ba'i yo byad dag kyang 'phrog go /
translated: some he punishes by confiscating their livelihood,

original: kha cig la ni lcag gis gzhu ba dang / btson rar bcug go /
analyzed: kha cig la ni lcag gis gzhu ba dang / btson rar bcug go /
translated: some he punishes by striking them with whips, and by imprisoning them,

original: kha cig la ni yan lag dang / nying lag gcod do //
analyzed: kha cig la ni yan lag dang / nying lag gcod do //
translated: some he punishes by cutting off their major and minor limbs,

original: kha cig la ni mgo dang / lus kyang gcod de /
analyzed: kha cig la ni mgo dang / lus kyang gcod de /
translated: some he punishes by cutting off their heads and bodies.

original: de dag la sogs pa chad pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis chad pa gcod do //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa chad pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis chad pa gcod do //
translated: He punishes them in these and other various ways.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: de ltar rgyal rigs rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po chen po rgyal po'i 'khor lo gsum po 'di dang ldan te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyal rigs rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po chen po rgyal po'i 'khor lo gsum po 'di dang ldan te /
translated: The great king of the warrior caste, anointed on the crown of his head, possesses these three wheels of a king.

original: 'khor lo de'i dbang gis bdag gi yul rab tu bde zhing skyid pas phas rgol ba'i dgra thams cad dang / grogs po ngan pa btul cing lus srung ba'i nan tan mkhas pas tshe'ang ring par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo de'i dbang gis bdag gi yul rab tu bde zhing skyid pas phas rgol ba'i dgra thams cad dang / grogs po ngan pa btul cing lus srung ba'i nan tan mkhas pas tshe'ang ring par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of that wheel, my country is very happy and peaceful. I have subdued all hostile enemies and bad friends. I am skilled in the earnest practice of protecting my body, and so my life is long.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang dbang po la shin tu mkhas pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas 'khor @195a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang dbang po la shin tu mkhas pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas 'khor @195a *//
translated: in the same way, the Tathāgata, too, is endowed with the wisdom of being very skilled in the faculties.

original: gang bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang / thabs dang / shes rab las ring du gyur pa /
analyzed: gang bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang / thabs dang / shes rab las ring du gyur pa /
translated: Those who are far removed from the accumulation of merit and wisdom, from skillful means and insight,

original: sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang / zhi ba yongs su spangs te dran pa nyams nas sems 'khrugs par gyur pa dag nga gang na ba der 'ongs te /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang / zhi ba yongs su spangs te dran pa nyams nas sems 'khrugs par gyur pa dag nga gang na ba der 'ongs te /
translated: who have abandoned generosity, self-control, and tranquility, whose mindfulness has declined and whose minds are disturbed, come to me wherever I am.

original: nga la skyabs su 'ongs nas de dag gi dbang po dang / dad pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / mos pa shin tu mkhyen pas ci dang / cis 'dul ba bzhin du chad pas gcad pa'i thabs 'dul ba la sogs pa'i chos ston to //
analyzed: nga la skyabs su 'ongs nas de dag gi dbang po dang / dad pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / mos pa shin tu mkhyen pas ci dang / cis 'dul ba bzhin du chad pas gcad pa'i thabs 'dul ba la sogs pa'i chos ston to //
translated: Having come to me for refuge, I teach them the Dharma, such as the Vinaya, the means of cutting through with the weapon of the Dharma, in accordance with their faculties, faith, latent tendencies, and aspirations.

original: sems can gang nga rgyal gyi dbang du gyur te /
analyzed: sems can gang nga rgyal gyi dbang du gyur te /
translated: For those sentient beings who are under the sway of pride,

original: bslab pa mang po gzungs su mi 'dzin pa dag la ni ngas bstan pa dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir dngos po 'di dag byed du gzhug go /
analyzed: bslab pa mang po gzungs su mi 'dzin pa dag la ni ngas bstan pa dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir dngos po 'di dag byed du gzhug go /
translated: who do not hold the many precepts in mind, I have these things done in order to make the holy Dharma last long.

original: la lar ni dran par bya ba'i dam bca' bas chad pas gcod do //🔽la lar ni tshig na bas bsdigs pa dang / gshe ba dang / spyo bas gcod do //
analyzed: la lar ni dran par bya ba'i dam bca' bas chad pas gcod do // la lar ni tshig na bas bsdigs pa dang / gshe ba dang / spyo bas gcod do //
translated: In some cases, I cut through with a vow to remember.🔽In some cases, I cut through with scolding, reproaching, and rebuking.

original: la lar ni skad cig dgar zhing smra dbab pas gcod do //
analyzed: la lar ni skad cig dgar zhing smra dbab pas gcod do //
translated: In some cases, I cut through with a moment of laughter and letting go of speech.

original: la lar ni phyag 'tshal ba dang / mi smra ba dang / rnyed pa lhan cig tu mi spyod pas gcod do //
analyzed: la lar ni phyag 'tshal ba dang / mi smra ba dang / rnyed pa lhan cig tu mi spyod pas gcod do //
translated: In some cases, I cut through with prostrations, silence, and not sharing gains.

original: la lar ni rtsa dgram pa lta bu dang / la lar ni bskrad pa la sogs pa'i chad pas gcad pa ste /
analyzed: la lar ni rtsa dgram pa lta bu dang / la lar ni bskrad pa la sogs pa'i chad pas gcad pa ste /
translated: and some are punished by being expelled and so forth.

original: de ltar gang zag de dag gi dbang po dang / dad pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / mos pa kun mkhyen pas ci rigs ci 'os su chad pas gcad do //🔽de'ang don med pa'i mun pa'i tshogs bsags @195b pa gzhom pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i chu bo bskam pa dang / mtho ris kyi lhar skye ba nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bde ba thob pa'i phyir mi dge ba spyod pa'i gang zag 'dul ba'i phyir ci dang /
analyzed: de ltar gang zag de dag gi dbang po dang / dad pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / mos pa kun mkhyen pas ci rigs ci 'os su chad pas gcad do // de'ang don med pa'i mun pa'i tshogs bsags @195b pa gzhom pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i chu bo bskam pa dang / mtho ris kyi lhar skye ba nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bde ba thob pa'i phyir mi dge ba spyod pa'i gang zag 'dul ba'i phyir ci dang /
translated: Thus, the Omniscient One punishes those persons in whatever way is appropriate, according to their faculties, their faith, their latent tendencies, and their inclinations.

original: ci rigs su chad pas gcad pa'i chos bstan to //
analyzed: ci rigs su chad pas gcad pa'i chos bstan to //
translated: Moreover, in order to destroy the mass of meaningless darkness, to dry up the river of afflictions, and to attain the happiness of birth as a god in the higher realms up to the bliss of nirvana, the Dharma of punishment is taught in whatever way is appropriate in order to discipline those persons who engage in non-virtue.

original: mdo sde mang po las kyang mi dge ba spyod pa chad pas gcad pa'i chos ci dang / ci rig pa de dang / de'i chos rgya cher bshad do //
analyzed: mdo sde mang po las kyang mi dge ba spyod pa chad pas gcad pa'i chos ci dang / ci rig pa de dang / de'i chos rgya cher bshad do //
translated: In many sutras, the Dharma of punishment for those who engage in non-virtue is extensively explained in whatever way is appropriate.

original: ngas mchog dam pa'i ye shes kyis sems can gang lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / dad pa dang / mos pa yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa'ang shin tu mkhyen pas ci dang / cis 'dul ba bzhin du dge ba'i phyogs kyi khyad par rnam pa sna tshogs bstan te /
analyzed: ngas mchog dam pa'i ye shes kyis sems can gang lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / dad pa dang / mos pa yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa'ang shin tu mkhyen pas ci dang / cis 'dul ba bzhin du dge ba'i phyogs kyi khyad par rnam pa sna tshogs bstan te /
translated: I know with the wisdom of the highest truth the various superior thoughts, faiths, and aspirations of sentient beings, and I teach them the various aspects of the virtuous side in accordance with what will tame them and what they are like.

original: bslab cing goms su bcug pa nas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs shing 'jigs pa med pa'i grong khyer chen por btsud do //

translated: I have them train and practice, and I lead them to the great city of fearlessness, where I perfect all their roots of virtue.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: nga ni de ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'khor lo gsum po 'di dang ldan te 'khor lo 'di'i dbang gis sems can thams cad kyi dbang po rnam pa sna tshogs dang / dad pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / mos pa dang / bsam pa dang /

translated: I have this wheel of the three turnings of the Dharma wheel in my buddha realm. By the power of this wheel, I know the various faculties, faiths, latent tendencies, aspirations, thoughts, and natures of all sentient beings.

translated: Because he knows all the phenomena of karma and experience, he fearlessly establishes them in happiness with the meaning of benefit and happiness, in accordance with how they are to be tamed.

original: dang / bdud du bcas pa'i mu stegs can log par smra ba thams cad btul te 'khor mang po'i dkyil 'khor du seng ge'i sgra bsgrags so //🔽rigs kyi bu /

translated: Because of fearlessness, I make a vow in the abode of the great sage and turn the wheel of the Buddha. Having subdued all the non-Buddhist teachers and false teachers with their gods and demons, I roar the lion's roar in the midst of the assembly.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

translated: The great king of the warrior caste, anointed on the head, thinks, In my realm, as many persons as there are who have gone for refuge to the worldly gods and various non-Buddhists, and who have faith in falsehood,

translated: The great king, having understood this, always gathered them together again and again, and having taught them extensively with the former king’s system of the true Dharma, he made them abandon wrong views

analyzed: log par dad pa spong la /

translated: For that, I will have them meditate on the medicine of dependent origination.

analyzed: sems can gang dbugs bgrang ba yid la byas pas nad zhi bar 'os pa zhig na /
translated: If a sentient being is suitable to be cured of an illness by keeping the breath in mind,

original: de la dbugs bgrang pa yid la bya ba'i sman sgom du bcug go /
analyzed: de la dbugs bgrang pa yid la bya ba'i sman sgom du bcug go /
translated: I will have them meditate on the medicine of keeping the breath in mind.

original: sems can gang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar 'os pa zhig na /
analyzed: sems can gang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar 'os pa zhig na /
translated: If a sentient being is suitable to be cured of the illness of the afflictions by meditating on the three gates of liberation,

original: de la rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi sman sgom du bcug go /
analyzed: de la rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi sman sgom du bcug go /
translated: I will have them meditate on the medicine of the three gates of liberation.

original: sems can gang bsam @201b gtan bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar 'os pa zhig na /
analyzed: sems can gang bsam @201b gtan bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar 'os pa zhig na /
translated: If a sentient being is suitable to be cured of the illness of the afflictions by meditating on the dhyānas,

original: de la bsam gtan gyi sman sgom du bcug go /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gyi sman sgom du bcug go /
translated: I will have them meditate on the medicine of the dhyānas.

original: sems can gang gzugs med pa'i bsam gtan bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar 'os pa zhig na /
analyzed: sems can gang gzugs med pa'i bsam gtan bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar 'os pa zhig na /
translated: If a sentient being is suitable to be cured of the illness of the afflictions by meditating on the formless dhyānas,

original: de la gzugs med pa'i bsam gtan sgom du bcug go /
analyzed: de la gzugs med pa'i bsam gtan sgom du bcug go /
translated: I will have them meditate on the medicine of the formless dhyānas.

original: sems can gang dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar 'os pa zhig na /
analyzed: sems can gang dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar 'os pa zhig na /
translated: If a sentient being is fit to have the illness of the afflictions cured by cultivating the meditative stabilization of the Heroic One,

original: de la dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sman sgom du bcug go /
analyzed: de la dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sman sgom du bcug go /
translated: then he is made to cultivate the medicine of the meditative stabilization of the Heroic One.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can dag la de lta bu'i chos kyi sman gyis sbyin pa mdzad do //🔽snod du gyur pa'i sems can thams cad bdud rnam bzhi'i dbang du 'gyur bar mi mdzad do //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can dag la de lta bu'i chos kyi sman gyis sbyin pa mdzad do // snod du gyur pa'i sems can thams cad bdud rnam bzhi'i dbang du 'gyur bar mi mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata gives the gift of such a medicinal Dharma to sentient beings.🔽He does not make all sentient beings who are vessels go under the power of the four māras.

original: snod du gyur pa'i sems can thams cad lha dang / mi'i theg pa la rgyab kyis phyogs shing ngan song du gzhol bar mi mdzad do //
analyzed: snod du gyur pa'i sems can thams cad lha dang / mi'i theg pa la rgyab kyis phyogs shing ngan song du gzhol bar mi mdzad do //
translated: He does not make all sentient beings who are vessels turn their backs on the vehicle of gods and humans and head for the lower realms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa'i chos kyi sman dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung myur du med par 'gyur bar mi mdzad de; de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams la de lta bu'i chos kyi sman gyi sbyin pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa'i chos kyi sman dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung myur du med par 'gyur bar mi mdzad de; de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams la de lta bu'i chos kyi sman gyi sbyin pa mdzad do //
translated: The Tathāgata does not allow the lineage of the unsurpassed medicine of the Dharma and the lineage of the Three Jewels to be quickly extinguished. In this way, the Tathāgata gives the gift of the medicine of the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo bdun pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo bdun pa dang ldan te /
translated: the Tathāgata possesses the seventh wheel of the Dharma,

original: 'khor lo de'i dbang gis bla na med pa kun tu 'gro ba'i ye shes kyi spyod pas sems can thams cad la chos kyi sman rnam pa sna tshogs byin pa de sgom du btsud @202a *//
analyzed: 'khor lo de'i dbang gis bla na med pa kun tu 'gro ba'i ye shes kyi spyod pas sems can thams cad la chos kyi sman rnam pa sna tshogs byin pa de sgom du btsud @202a *//
translated: and through the power of that wheel, he teaches the unsurpassed, all-pervading knowledge and the practice of the Dharma, and he causes sentient beings to apply themselves to the various medicines of the Dharma.

original: na nyon mongs pa'i nad kun zhi zhing 'jigs pa med pa la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na nyon mongs pa'i nad kun zhi zhing 'jigs pa med pa la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do so, all their afflictions will be pacified, and they will be able to abide in fearlessness and happiness.”

original: 'jigs pa med pas nga ni drang srong chen po'i gnas su bzhugs te; sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo bskor nas lha dang / bdud du bcas pa'i mu stegs can log par smra ba thams cad btul te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pas nga ni drang srong chen po'i gnas su bzhugs te; sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo bskor nas lha dang / bdud du bcas pa'i mu stegs can log par smra ba thams cad btul te /
translated: I am fearless, and so I dwell in the abode of the great sages. I turn the wheel of the Dharma and tame all the non-Buddhists, including the gods and Māra, who speak falsely.

original: 'khor mang po'i dkyil 'khor du seng ge'i sgra sgrogs so //🔽rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: 'khor mang po'i dkyil 'khor du seng ge'i sgra sgrogs so // rigs kyi bu /
translated: I roar the lion’s roar in the midst of the assembly.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “Son of noble family, it is like this:

original: rgyal rigs rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po chen po bdag dang / gzhan gyi rigs dang / thog ma btsas pa dang / gzhon nu'i tshe rtse ba la sogs pa thams cad la dran pa mngon par bzhag ces sems so //
analyzed: rgyal rigs rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po chen po bdag dang / gzhan gyi rigs dang / thog ma btsas pa dang / gzhon nu'i tshe rtse ba la sogs pa thams cad la dran pa mngon par bzhag ces sems so //
translated: the great king of the warrior caste, anointed on the head, thinks, ‘I will be mindful of myself and others, of our lineage, of our birth, and of our youth and play.’

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: gnas gang du thog ma btsas pa dang / khrus byas pa dang / bang du blangs shing nu zho snun pa dang / lus dang; yan lag gi tshogs mnyes pa dang / dga' bzhin du rtse ba dang / sa dang / bye ma la rtse ba dang /
analyzed: gnas gang du thog ma btsas pa dang / khrus byas pa dang / bang du blangs shing nu zho snun pa dang / lus dang; yan lag gi tshogs mnyes pa dang / dga' bzhin du rtse ba dang / sa dang / bye ma la rtse ba dang /
translated: ‘I was born in such and such a place, bathed, held on the lap, nursed, and my body and limbs were massaged. I played happily, and I played in the dirt and sand.

original: 'khor dang bcas te bag med pa rnam pa mang pos rtse ba dang / rtsal sbyong ba dang / de ma yin pa'i las rnam pa gzhan byed pa dang / rgyal po gzhan gyi yul du rgyu zhing 'gro ba dang / rgyal po'i bya ba sgrub pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas te bag med pa rnam pa mang pos rtse ba dang / rtsal sbyong ba dang / de ma yin pa'i las rnam pa gzhan byed pa dang / rgyal po gzhan gyi yul du rgyu zhing 'gro ba dang / rgyal po'i bya ba sgrub pa dang /
translated: He will be surrounded by his retinue, and he will play with many kinds of carelessness, train in sports, do other kinds of work, travel to the lands of other kings, and accomplish the king’s duties.🔽He will be a king’s servant, a king’s minister, a king’s son, and having obtained the kingdom, he will experience great happiness and enjoyments, and his great fame will be known in all directions.

original: rgyal po'i las byed pa dang / rgyal tsha ba byed pa dang / rgyal thabs thob nas dbang du gyur te bde ba'i longs spyod chen po myong ba dang / grags pa chen pos phyogs kun tu grags pa dang / dngos po de dag la sogs pa bsams te dran nas @202b rgyal po snga ma'i chos lugs yang dag pa rnam par gzhag nas de na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad la 'tshe skyong ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i las byed pa dang / rgyal tsha ba byed pa dang / rgyal thabs thob nas dbang du gyur te bde ba'i longs spyod chen po myong ba dang / grags pa chen pos phyogs kun tu grags pa dang / dngos po de dag la sogs pa bsams te dran nas @202b rgyal po snga ma'i chos lugs yang dag pa rnam par gzhag nas de na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad la 'tshe skyong ste /
translated: Having thought about these things and remembered them, he will establish the former king’s true way of Dharma and protect all the beings who live there.

original: bdag gi srid 'dzin cing pha rol mi 'tsho'o //
analyzed: bdag gi srid 'dzin cing pha rol mi 'tsho'o //
translated: He will hold his own kingdom and not harm others.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: rgyal rigs rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po chen po de ltar rgyal po'i 'khor lo brgyad pa 'di dang ldan te /
analyzed: rgyal rigs rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po chen po de ltar rgyal po'i 'khor lo brgyad pa 'di dang ldan te /
translated: The great king of the warrior class, who has been consecrated on the crown of his head, possesses these eight wheels of a king.

original: 'khor lo de'i dbang gis bdag gi yul rab tu bde zhing skyid pa dang / phas rgol ba'i dgra dang / grogs po ngan pa thams cad btul te lus bsrung ba'i nan tan la mkhas pas tshe'ang ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo de'i dbang gis bdag gi yul rab tu bde zhing skyid pa dang / phas rgol ba'i dgra dang / grogs po ngan pa thams cad btul te lus bsrung ba'i nan tan la mkhas pas tshe'ang ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of these wheels, his own country is happy and prosperous, and he subdues all enemies and bad friends. Because he is skilled in the practice of protecting his body, his life will be long.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa; yang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor na bzhugs pa'i tshe bdag dang / pha rol po gzhan gyi sngon gyi skye ba tshad med pa snyed na ci byas pa'i dngos po kun dgongs so //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa; yang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor na bzhugs pa'i tshe bdag dang / pha rol po gzhan gyi sngon gyi skye ba tshad med pa snyed na ci byas pa'i dngos po kun dgongs so //
translated: In the same way, when the Tathāgata is seated in the middle of the assembly, he reflects on all the things that have been done by himself and others in the course of immeasurable previous lives.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: skye ba gcig dang / skye ba gnyis dang / skye ba gsum nas skye ba tshad med pa brgya stong gi bar gyi ci byas pa'i dngos po kun dgongs so //
analyzed: skye ba gcig dang / skye ba gnyis dang / skye ba gsum nas skye ba tshad med pa brgya stong gi bar gyi ci byas pa'i dngos po kun dgongs so //
translated: He reflects on all the things that have been done in one life, two lives, three lives, up to immeasurable hundreds of thousands of lives.

original: de bzhin du bskal pa 'grub pa dgongs pa nas bskal pa 'jig pa'ang dgongs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bskal pa 'grub pa dgongs pa nas bskal pa 'jig pa'ang dgongs so //
translated: In the same way, he knows the formation of the world and its destruction.

original: bskal pa chad med pa 'grub pa dang / bskal pa tshad med pa 'jig pa'i bar du thams cad dgongs te /🔽'di ni sngon 'das pa'i dus na che ge mo zhig na 'dug 'dug ste rigs ni 'di zhes bya'o //🔽ming ni 'di zhes bya'o //🔽rus ni 'di zhes bya'o //🔽kha zas ni 'di za za'o //
analyzed: bskal pa chad med pa 'grub pa dang / bskal pa tshad med pa 'jig pa'i bar du thams cad dgongs te / 'di ni sngon 'das pa'i dus na che ge mo zhig na 'dug 'dug ste rigs ni 'di zhes bya'o // ming ni 'di zhes bya'o // rus ni 'di zhes bya'o // kha zas ni 'di za za'o //
translated: He knows all, from the formation of the world without beginning to its destruction without remainder.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal yang 'di dag myong ngo //🔽tshe ni 'di snyed cig go /🔽'di snyed kyi @203a *//
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal yang 'di dag myong ngo // tshe ni 'di snyed cig go / 'di snyed kyi @203a *//
translated: He knows the past, “In the past, he was in such a place, his family was such, his name was such, his caste was such, his food was such, he lived for so long a time, he experienced such happiness and suffering, he lived for so long, he lived for so long.🔽At the end of his life, he died here and was reborn there.🔽He died there and was reborn here.

original: bar du 'dug 'dug go /
analyzed: bar du 'dug 'dug go /
translated: Here he was such, his family was such, his name was such, his caste was such, his food was such, he lived for so long, he lived for so long.

original: tshe'i mthar thug pa na che ge mo zhig tu tshe 'phos nas 'di dag tu skyes so //
analyzed: tshe'i mthar thug pa na che ge mo zhig tu tshe 'phos nas 'di dag tu skyes so //
translated: At the end of his life, he died here and was reborn there.”

original: 'di dag tu tshe 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes pa la sogs pa dngos po tshad dpag tu med pa kun dgongs pas sems can gyi dbang po so so ji lta ba bzhin du dam pa'i chos ston te /
analyzed: 'di dag tu tshe 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes pa la sogs pa dngos po tshad dpag tu med pa kun dgongs pas sems can gyi dbang po so so ji lta ba bzhin du dam pa'i chos ston te /
translated: He knows all the immeasurable things, such as Having passed away from there, he was born there, and so on. He teaches the sublime Dharma according to the individual faculties of sentient beings.

original: phan pa dang / bde ba'i don mdzad do //
analyzed: phan pa dang / bde ba'i don mdzad do //
translated: He acts for the benefit and happiness of sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: nga de ltar de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo brgyad pa 'di dang ldan te /
analyzed: nga de ltar de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo brgyad pa 'di dang ldan te /
translated: I am thus endowed with this eighth wheel of the Buddha.

original: 'khor lo de'i dbang gis sems can tshad med pa la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don gyis 'jigs pa med pa la bde par bkod do //
analyzed: 'khor lo de'i dbang gis sems can tshad med pa la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don gyis 'jigs pa med pa la bde par bkod do //
translated: By the power of that wheel, I establish immeasurable sentient beings in fearlessness for the sake of benefit and happiness.

original: 'jigs pa med pas nga ni drang srong chen po'i gnas su bzhugs te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pas nga ni drang srong chen po'i gnas su bzhugs te /
translated: Fearless, I dwell in the abode of the great sage.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo bskor nas lha dang / bdud du bcas pa'i mu stegs can la sogs pa log par smra ba thams cad btul te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo bskor nas lha dang / bdud du bcas pa'i mu stegs can la sogs pa log par smra ba thams cad btul te /
translated: Having turned the wheel of the Buddha, I tame all the non-Buddhist teachers, such as the gods and Māra, and all the false teachers.

original: 'khor mang po'i dkyil 'khor du seng ge'i sgra sgrogs so //
analyzed: 'khor mang po'i dkyil 'khor du seng ge'i sgra sgrogs so //
translated: In the midst of the assembly, I roar the lion's roar.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: rgyal rigs rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po chen po ni bsams pa bzhin du bdag gi ris na gnas pa'i sems can gyi rigs dang / rus dang / rtsal ci yod pa dang / las kyi dngos po ci byed pa dang /
analyzed: rgyal rigs rgyal thabs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po chen po ni bsams pa bzhin du bdag gi ris na gnas pa'i sems can gyi rigs dang / rus dang / rtsal ci yod pa dang / las kyi dngos po ci byed pa dang /
translated: The great king who has been consecrated on the crown of his head as a royal priest can think of the type of being that lives in his realm, their family lineage, their abilities, the nature of their work,

original: 'di nas tshe 'phos nas gang du skye ba dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu bzang ngan gyi khyad par mi mthun pa kun shin tu rtog go /
analyzed: 'di nas tshe 'phos nas gang du skye ba dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu bzang ngan gyi khyad par mi mthun pa kun shin tu rtog go /
translated: where they will be reborn after they die here, and the differences between the good and bad causes and effects.

original: sems can gang su'i khyim du skyes na rtul phod cing dpa' ba dang / zhan cing sdar ba dang / bzo rtsal @203b bslabs na lobs pa dang / mi lobs pa dang / las ci byed pa dang / dge ba byed pa dang / sdig pa byed pa dang /
analyzed: sems can gang su'i khyim du skyes na rtul phod cing dpa' ba dang / zhan cing sdar ba dang / bzo rtsal @203b bslabs na lobs pa dang / mi lobs pa dang / las ci byed pa dang / dge ba byed pa dang / sdig pa byed pa dang /
translated: He knows everything about the people who are born in whose house, whether they are brave and courageous or weak and timid, whether they can learn a craft or not, what work they do, whether they do good or evil,

original: phyug cing btsan pa dang / dbul zhing nyen pa dang / mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa kun shes pa nas tshe 'pho ba'i bar du kun shes te /
analyzed: phyug cing btsan pa dang / dbul zhing nyen pa dang / mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa kun shes pa nas tshe 'pho ba'i bar du kun shes te /
translated: whether they are rich and powerful or poor and weak, whether they are attractive or unattractive, and so forth, up to their death.

original: gang su zhig las ma zad par 'chi ba dang / gang ni las zad de 'chi ba dang / gang ni rgyal po'i khrims 'gal nas bsad pa dang / gang ni dgras bsad pa dang / gang ni lcag gis gzhus pas 'chi ba dang / gang ni btson rar bcug pas 'chi ba dang /
analyzed: gang su zhig las ma zad par 'chi ba dang / gang ni las zad de 'chi ba dang / gang ni rgyal po'i khrims 'gal nas bsad pa dang / gang ni dgras bsad pa dang / gang ni lcag gis gzhus pas 'chi ba dang / gang ni btson rar bcug pas 'chi ba dang /
translated: Some die before their time is up, some die when their time is up, some are killed for breaking the king’s laws, some are killed by enemies, some die from being whipped, some die in prison,

original: gang ni bzo rtsal sbyong ba'i phyir 'chi ba dang / gang ni phas rgol ba'i dgra'i g-yul ngor 'chi ba dang / gang ni rtsod cing 'thabs nas 'chi ba dang / gang ni nor dbyig srung ba'i phyir 'chi ba dang / gang ni 'dod chags kyi dbang gis 'chi ba dang /
analyzed: gang ni bzo rtsal sbyong ba'i phyir 'chi ba dang / gang ni phas rgol ba'i dgra'i g-yul ngor 'chi ba dang / gang ni rtsod cing 'thabs nas 'chi ba dang / gang ni nor dbyig srung ba'i phyir 'chi ba dang / gang ni 'dod chags kyi dbang gis 'chi ba dang /
translated: some die while learning a craft, some die in battle against opposing armies, some die while arguing and fighting, some die while protecting their wealth, some die through the power of desire,

original: gang ni khong khro zhing 'khon du 'dzin pa'i phyir 'chi ba dang / gang ni ngal chad nas 'chi ba dang / gang ni ltogs te 'chi ba dang / gang ni nyes pa'i skyon dang bcas te 'chi ba dang / gang ni skyon med par 'chi ba dang /
analyzed: gang ni khong khro zhing 'khon du 'dzin pa'i phyir 'chi ba dang / gang ni ngal chad nas 'chi ba dang / gang ni ltogs te 'chi ba dang / gang ni nyes pa'i skyon dang bcas te 'chi ba dang / gang ni skyon med par 'chi ba dang /
translated: who die through anger and resentment, who die through exhaustion, who die through hunger, who die through faults and flaws, and who die without faults or flaws.

original: gang ni rgas 'khogs te 'chi ba dang / gang ni dar la bab ste 'chi ba dang / gang ni gzhon nu byis pa'i tshe 'chi ba dang / gang ni dge ba'i las rnam pa mang po byas nas 'chi ba dang / gang ni mi dge ba'i las rnam pa mang po byas te 'chi ba dag kyang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gang ni rgas 'khogs te 'chi ba dang / gang ni dar la bab ste 'chi ba dang / gang ni gzhon nu byis pa'i tshe 'chi ba dang / gang ni dge ba'i las rnam pa mang po byas nas 'chi ba dang / gang ni mi dge ba'i las rnam pa mang po byas te 'chi ba dag kyang rab tu shes so //
translated: They know who dies old and decrepit, who dies in their prime, who dies young and as a child, who dies after doing many virtuous actions, and who dies after doing many nonvirtuous actions.

original: sems can gang ni dge ba sbyad pa'i rgyus shi na'ang mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur ba'ang shes te /
analyzed: sems can gang ni dge ba sbyad pa'i rgyus shi na'ang mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur ba'ang shes te /
translated: They know which beings, through the cause of virtuous activity, will be reborn in the higher realms after death.

original: sems @204a *// can gang ni mi dge ba sbyad pa'i rgyus tshe 'phos nas ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba'ang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems @204a *// can gang ni mi dge ba sbyad pa'i rgyus tshe 'phos nas ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba'ang rab tu shes so //
translated: He also knows which sentient beings, due to engaging in non-virtue, will be reborn in the lower realms after death.

original: de ltar dngos po de dag kun rab tu shes pas 'di snyam du bdag kyang brtson pa'i sbyor ba la lus dge ba dang / ngag dge ba dang / yid dge ba la spyod pa la shin tu brtson par bya'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po de dag kun rab tu shes pas 'di snyam du bdag kyang brtson pa'i sbyor ba la lus dge ba dang / ngag dge ba dang / yid dge ba la spyod pa la shin tu brtson par bya'o snyam du sems so //
translated: Knowing all these things, he thinks, ‘I too should be diligent in the practice of effort, and engage in virtuous physical, verbal, and mental conduct.’

original: bdag gis thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sbyin pa la goms par bya ba dang / zhi zhing dul bar bya ste tshe 'phos nas gnas bzang por skye bar bya yi /
