translated: Chapter Three

original: de nas 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de'i nang na tshangs pa chen po lha'i snying po zhes bya ba dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bskyed pa /
analyzed: de nas 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de'i nang na tshangs pa chen po lha'i snying po zhes bya ba dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bskyed pa /
translated: Then, in the midst of that assembly, there was a great Brahma named Divine Essence, who had greatly cultivated the roots of virtue,

original: sa bcu non pa /
analyzed: sa bcu non pa /
translated: mastered the ten grounds,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yon tan dang ldan pa zhig stan las langs nas thal mo sbyar te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yon tan dang ldan pa zhig stan las langs nas thal mo sbyar te /
translated: and possessed the qualities of a bodhisattva mahasattva. He rose from his seat, placed his palms together,🔽and said to the Buddha, World-Honored One, I now have a doubt in my mind. I wish to ask about it, but I fear it may offend the World-Honored One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag btsal nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag btsal nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so //
translated: Having bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, he spoke these verses:🔽“I ask and request of you,

original: shes rab rgya mtsho yon tan mdzod can la //
analyzed: shes rab rgya mtsho yon tan mdzod can la //
translated: O ocean of wisdom, treasury of qualities,

original: bdag gis the tshom zhu zhing gsol bar bgyi //
analyzed: bdag gis the tshom zhu zhing gsol bar bgyi //
translated: To clear away my conceptual doubts

original: shes rab rgya mtsho thugs rjes skabs phye ste //🔽bdag gi rtog pa'i the tshom bsal bar gsol //
analyzed: shes rab rgya mtsho thugs rjes skabs phye ste // bdag gi rtog pa'i the tshom bsal bar gsol //
translated: With the ocean of wisdom and compassion.

original: bdag cag skom gyis shin tu gdungs pa ltar //🔽yon tan snying po mchog gi chos ro dang // phul du gyur pa don dam chos kyi ro //
analyzed: bdag cag skom gyis shin tu gdungs pa ltar // yon tan snying po mchog gi chos ro dang // phul du gyur pa don dam chos kyi ro //
translated: Just as we are tormented by thirst,🔽I pray that the assembly may hear🔽The supreme taste of the Dharma, the essence of qualities,

original: 'khor du gyur pa thams cad thos par smon //
analyzed: 'khor du gyur pa thams cad thos par smon //
translated: And the ultimate taste of the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa chen po lha'i snying po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa chen po lha'i snying po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to the great Brahma God's Essence:

original: khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la ci dang / ci 'dod pa dris shig dang / ngas dris pa de dang / de'i lung bstan pas khyod kyi sems rangs par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la ci dang / ci 'dod pa dris shig dang / ngas dris pa de dang / de'i lung bstan pas khyod kyi sems rangs par bya'o //
translated: Ask the Tathagata whatever you wish. I will satisfy your mind with the answers to your questions.

original: tshangs pa chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen pos gsol pa /
translated: The great Brahma said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,🔽I will do so.”

original: de ltar bgyi'o zhes gsol nas tshigs su bcad de zhus pa /
analyzed: de ltar bgyi'o zhes gsol nas tshigs su bcad de zhus pa /
translated: Then he asked in verse:

original: shes rab ldan zhing ting 'dzin rab bsgoms te //
analyzed: shes rab ldan zhing ting 'dzin rab bsgoms te //
translated: “Those who have wisdom, who have cultivated samādhi,

original: bdag med pa la bde bar gnas pa'i rnams //🔽'on te dam pa'i don la gnas bgyi'am //
analyzed: bdag med pa la bde bar gnas pa'i rnams // 'on te dam pa'i don la gnas bgyi'am //
translated: And who abide happily in selflessness,🔽Should they abide in the ultimate truth,

original: 'on te 'khor ba'i 'khor bar gnas par bgyi //
analyzed: 'on te 'khor ba'i 'khor bar gnas par bgyi //
translated: Or should they abide in the cycle of saṃsāra?🔽Those who recite and cultivate

original: nyin mtshan chos mchog @210a *//🔽dam pa de dag la //🔽'don cing goms par bgyid de rtsol ba dag /🔽'on te nyon mongs mtsho las rgal bgyi'am //
analyzed: nyin mtshan chos mchog @210a *// dam pa de dag la // 'don cing goms par bgyid de rtsol ba dag / 'on te nyon mongs mtsho las rgal bgyi'am //
translated: The supreme Dharma day and night,🔽Should they cross the ocean of afflictions,

original: 'on ta ma ngan song dag tu ltung bar bgyi //
analyzed: 'on ta ma ngan song dag tu ltung bar bgyi //
translated: Or will they fall into the lower realms?

original: bsod nams byed la shin tu 'bad rtsol ba //
analyzed: bsod nams byed la shin tu 'bad rtsol ba //
translated: Those who strive in creating merit,

original: nges par mya ngan 'da' la gzhol 'gyur ram //🔽'on te 'khor ba'i 'khor bar gnas 'gyur ram //
analyzed: nges par mya ngan 'da' la gzhol 'gyur ram // 'on te 'khor ba'i 'khor bar gnas 'gyur ram //
translated: Will they definitely proceed to nirvāṇa,🔽Or will they remain in the cycle of saṃsāra,

original: 'on te ngan song dag tu ltung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'on te ngan song dag tu ltung bar 'gyur //
translated: Or will they fall into the lower realms?

original: shes rab ldan pa'i rgyal thabs dbang bskur te //
analyzed: shes rab ldan pa'i rgyal thabs dbang bskur te //
translated: Those who have wisdom and are crowned as kings,

original: 'khor lo rnam pa bcu dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: 'khor lo rnam pa bcu dang ldan pa dag /
translated: Who possess the ten aspects of the wheel,

original: 'on te 'khor ba'i nang du 'bying 'gyur ram //
analyzed: 'on te 'khor ba'i nang du 'bying 'gyur ram //
translated: Will I sink into the depths of saṃsāra,

original: 'on te sangs rgyas 'bras bu thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas 'bras bu thob par 'gyur //
translated: Or will I attain the fruit of buddhahood?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pas ni glags pa'i sems //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pas ni glags pa'i sems //
translated: The mind is afflicted by afflictions,

original: nyon mongs mang pos 'khrul bar gyur pa dag /
analyzed: nyon mongs mang pos 'khrul bar gyur pa dag /
translated: And those confused by many afflictions

original: ji ltar sems ni yongs su dag par sbyang //
analyzed: ji ltar sems ni yongs su dag par sbyang //
translated: How will the mind be completely purified?

original: sgom dang 'don pa'i las dag ji ltar bgyi //
analyzed: sgom dang 'don pa'i las dag ji ltar bgyi //
translated: How should I practice meditation and recitation?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa chen po lha'i snying po de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa chen po lha'i snying po de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the great Brahmā Hṛīḥkāra,

original: legs so // don de dag legs par zhu bar spobs ba legs te /
analyzed: legs so // don de dag legs par zhu bar spobs ba legs te /
translated: Excellent! It is excellent that you have the eloquence to ask about these topics.

original: khyod ni chos 'di dag la shin tu nan tan byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyod ni chos 'di dag la shin tu nan tan byed pa'o //
translated: You are diligent in these teachings.

original: khyod ni spyod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyod ni spyod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: You have perfected all practices.

original: khyod ni sngon 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das klung gangg'a'i bye ma snyed la sgo gsum yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: khyod ni sngon 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das klung gangg'a'i bye ma snyed la sgo gsum yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: You have purified the three doors for as many past blessed buddhas as there are sands in the Ganges river.

original: dam pa'i chos spel ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos spel ba'o //
translated: You have propagated the sublime Dharma.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung 'tshob pa ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung 'tshob pa ste /
translated: You are the heir of the Three Jewels.

original: de'ang sems can tshad med pa la phan pa dang / bde ba'i @210b don gyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la don zab mo 'di dag dris pa legs so //
analyzed: de'ang sems can tshad med pa la phan pa dang / bde ba'i @210b don gyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la don zab mo 'di dag dris pa legs so //
translated: It is excellent that you have asked the Tathāgata about these profound topics for the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to immeasurable sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: shes pa brda sprod pa chen po gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos yod de /
analyzed: shes pa brda sprod pa chen po gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos yod de /
translated: There is a great instruction on knowledge that should be upheld and not practiced.

original: sngon 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyis kyang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'khor ba las skyo bar bya ba dang / las dang / nyon mongs pa yongs su bcad pa dang / theg pa gsum myur du yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir shes pa brda sprod pa chen po gnas pa dang /🔽spyad par mi bya ba'i chos 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyis kyang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'khor ba las skyo bar bya ba dang / las dang / nyon mongs pa yongs su bcad pa dang / theg pa gsum myur du yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir shes pa brda sprod pa chen po gnas pa dang /🔽spyad par mi bya ba'i chos 'di gsungs so //
translated: In the past, all the blessed buddhas have taught this great instruction on knowledge that should be upheld and not practiced in order to ripen all sentient beings, to make them weary of saṃsāra, to cut through their karma and afflictions, and to quickly perfect the three vehicles.

original: da ltar phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyis kyang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'khor ba las skyo bar bya ba dang / las dang / nyon mongs pa yongs su bcad pa dang /
analyzed: da ltar phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyis kyang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'khor ba las skyo bar bya ba dang / las dang / nyon mongs pa yongs su bcad pa dang /
translated: All the blessed buddhas who are present in the ten directions also proclaim this great Dharma discourse that teaches understanding in order to ripen all sentient beings, to make them weary of saṃsāra, to cut through their karma and afflictions,

original: theg pa gsum myur du yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir shes pa brda sprod pa chen po gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos 'di la gnas pa gsung ngo //
analyzed: theg pa gsum myur du yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir shes pa brda sprod pa chen po gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos 'di la gnas pa gsung ngo //
translated: and to quickly perfect the three vehicles.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'khor ba las skyo bar bya ba dang / las dang / nyon mongs pa yongs su gcad par bya ba dang / theg pa gsum myur du yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir shes pa brda sprod pa chen po gnas pa dang /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'khor ba las skyo bar bya ba dang / las dang / nyon mongs pa yongs su gcad par bya ba dang / theg pa gsum myur du yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir shes pa brda sprod pa chen po gnas pa dang /
translated: All the blessed buddhas of the future also proclaim this great Dharma discourse that teaches understanding in order to ripen all sentient beings, to make them weary of saṃsāra, to cut through their karma and afflictions,🔽and to quickly perfect the three vehicles.

original: spyod par mi bya ba'i chos 'di la gnas par bya ba 'di dag @211a *//🔽gsung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyod par mi bya ba'i chos 'di la gnas par bya ba 'di dag @211a *// gsung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: You should abide by this Dharma that is to be practiced.

original: khyod kyis sngon 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las shes pa brda sprod pa chen po gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos 'di la gnas par bya ba 'di rdzogs par thos pa de ngas kyang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang /
analyzed: khyod kyis sngon 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las shes pa brda sprod pa chen po gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos 'di la gnas par bya ba 'di rdzogs par thos pa de ngas kyang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang /
translated: You have previously heard this great instruction on knowledge from the Tathāgatas of the past, and you have completely heard this Dharma that is to be practiced. I will also teach this great instruction on knowledge, this Dharma that is to be practiced, in order to bring all beings to maturity,

original: 'khor ba las skyo bar bya ba dang / las dang / nyon mongs pa yongs su gcad pa dang / theg pa gsum myur du yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir shes pa brda sprod pa chen po gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos 'di la gnas par bya ba 'di la bstan par bya yi /
analyzed: 'khor ba las skyo bar bya ba dang / las dang / nyon mongs pa yongs su gcad pa dang / theg pa gsum myur du yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir shes pa brda sprod pa chen po gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos 'di la gnas par bya ba 'di la bstan par bya yi /
translated: to cause them to be disenchanted with saṃsāra, to cut off karma and afflictions, and to quickly perfect the three vehicles.

original: de bas na skyes bu dam pa khyod kyis legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig dang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu dam pa khyod kyis legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig dang bstan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, O noble one, listen well and keep it in mind, and I will teach it.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ltar bgyi'o zhes gsol nas /
analyzed: de ltar bgyi'o zhes gsol nas /
translated: The great Brahma God Essence replied, I will do as you say.

original: tshangs pa chen po lha'i snying po bcom ldan 'das la phyir nyan to //
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po lha'i snying po bcom ldan 'das la phyir nyan to //
translated: He then returned to the World Honored One to listen.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa chen po lha'i snying po la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa chen po lha'i snying po la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha told the great Brahma God Essence:

original: gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos rnam pa bcu yod de /
analyzed: gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos rnam pa bcu yod de /
translated: There are ten kinds of dharmas that should not be practiced or cultivated.

original: gal te rnal 'byor can dag spyod pa ngan pa 'di las 'ga' tsam gyi rjes su zhugs na'ang 'dod pa'i khams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba tsam yang yongs su mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gal te rnal 'byor can dag spyod pa ngan pa 'di las 'ga' tsam gyi rjes su zhugs na'ang 'dod pa'i khams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba tsam yang yongs su mi 'grub bo //
translated: If practitioners engage in any of these bad practices, they will not even accomplish the roots of goodness of the desire realm.

original: ji ste sngar grub na'ang de ma thag tu phyir stor cing nyams par gyur na gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin nas theg pa gsum dang / theg pa gcig gi bar du thob par 'gyur ba @211b lta ci smos /
analyzed: ji ste sngar grub na'ang de ma thag tu phyir stor cing nyams par gyur na gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin nas theg pa gsum dang / theg pa gcig gi bar du thob par 'gyur ba @211b lta ci smos /
translated: If they have already accomplished them, they will immediately lose and destroy them. How much more so for attaining the concentrations of form and formlessness, up to the three vehicles and the one vehicle.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'jig rten na kha cig ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang 'tsho ba'i yo byad kyis brel pas tshol ba'i rkyen gyis nyon mongs pa dang / kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang tshul khrims nyams shing kha na ma thob mang po byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten na kha cig ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang 'tsho ba'i yo byad kyis brel pas tshol ba'i rkyen gyis nyon mongs pa dang / kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang tshul khrims nyams shing kha na ma thob mang po byed pa dang /
translated: In the world, some people, though they wish to cultivate concentration, are distracted by the pursuit of necessities for life.🔽Some people, though they wish to cultivate concentration, violate morality and commit many misdeeds.🔽Some people, though they wish to cultivate concentration, are attached to the good and bad omens of the world, and their minds and bodies are not disciplined.

original: kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang phyin ci log tu lta zhing 'jig rten gyi ltas bzang ngan la chags te lus dang / sems mdul ba dang / kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang sems g-yo zhing rgod pas 'phags pa la ma gzhol te dbang po rgod pa dang /
analyzed: kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang phyin ci log tu lta zhing 'jig rten gyi ltas bzang ngan la chags te lus dang / sems mdul ba dang / kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang sems g-yo zhing rgod pas 'phags pa la ma gzhol te dbang po rgod pa dang /
translated: Some people, though they wish to cultivate concentration, are distracted and agitated, and do not submit to the noble ones, and their faculties are wild.

original: kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang phra ma byed pa la dga' bas dbyen byed pa dang / kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang ngag rtsub pos 'phags pa la smod cing dbang za ba dang / kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang tshig kyal pa dang /
analyzed: kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang phra ma byed pa la dga' bas dbyen byed pa dang / kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang ngag rtsub pos 'phags pa la smod cing dbang za ba dang / kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang tshig kyal pa dang /
translated: Some, though they wish to cultivate concentration, with idle chatter and🔽lying,🔽Some, though they wish to cultivate concentration, with desire and envy, are displeased with others' gain, honor, and wealth.

original: brdzun du smra ba dang / kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang 'dod chags dang / phrag dog gis gzhan gyi khe dang / bsti stang dang / rnyed pa la mi dga' ba dang / kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang zhe sdang dang bcas pas sems can la gnod sems skyes pa dang /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba dang / kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang 'dod chags dang / phrag dog gis gzhan gyi khe dang / bsti stang dang / rnyed pa la mi dga' ba dang / kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang zhe sdang dang bcas pas sems can la gnod sems skyes pa dang /
translated: Some, though they wish to cultivate concentration, with hatred, give rise to malice toward sentient beings.

original: kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang log par lta ba dang bcas pas rgyu dang 'bras bu med par lta ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin sgom 'dod kyang log par lta ba dang bcas pas rgyu dang 'bras bu med par lta ba'o //
translated: Some, though they wish to cultivate concentration, with wrong views, regard cause and effect as nonexistent.

original: tshangs pa chen po /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po /
translated: Brahmā,

original: de ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: you should understand it thus.

original: 'di dag ni gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos rnam pa bcu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos rnam pa bcu zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the ten dharmas that should not be practiced and that should not be cultivated.

original: gal te ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dag spyod pa ngan pa 'di @212a *//
analyzed: gal te ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dag spyod pa ngan pa 'di @212a *//
translated: If those who cultivate samādhi engage in any of these bad practices,

original: dag las 'ga' tsam gyi rjes su zhugs na 'dod pa'i khams kyi dge ba'ang yongs su mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: dag las 'ga' tsam gyi rjes su zhugs na 'dod pa'i khams kyi dge ba'ang yongs su mi 'grub bo //
translated: they will not accomplish even the virtue of the desire realm.

original: ji ste sngar grub na'ang de ma theg tu stor cing nyams par 'gyur na gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / theg pa gsum dang / gcig thob par 'gyur pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: ji ste sngar grub na'ang de ma theg tu stor cing nyams par 'gyur na gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / theg pa gsum dang / gcig thob par 'gyur pa lta ci smos /
translated: If they have previously accomplished it, they will lose it and it will disappear. What need is there to mention the samādhis of the form and formless realms, or the attainment of the three vehicles?

original: tshangs pa chen po /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po /
translated: “Mahābrahmā,

original: gzhan yang / gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos rnam pa bcu yod do /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos rnam pa bcu yod do /
translated: there are another ten dharmas that should not be practiced and that should not be cultivated.

original: ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dag spyod pa ngan pa 'di dag las 'ga' zhig dang ldan na ting nge 'dzin yongs su mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dag spyod pa ngan pa 'di dag las 'ga' zhig dang ldan na ting nge 'dzin yongs su mi 'grub bo //
translated: If those who cultivate samādhi engage in any of these bad practices, they will not accomplish samādhi.

original: ji ste sngar grub na'ang de ma thag tu stor cing nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste sngar grub na'ang de ma thag tu stor cing nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they have previously accomplished it, they will lose it and it will disappear.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: las su bya ba'i dngos po la dga' zhing chags pa dang / bre mo'i gtam la dga' zhing chags pa dang / gnyid kyis log pa la dga' zhing chags pa dang / zang zing tshol ba la dga' zhing chags pa dang / gzugs bzang po la dga' zhing chags pa dang /
analyzed: las su bya ba'i dngos po la dga' zhing chags pa dang / bre mo'i gtam la dga' zhing chags pa dang / gnyid kyis log pa la dga' zhing chags pa dang / zang zing tshol ba la dga' zhing chags pa dang / gzugs bzang po la dga' zhing chags pa dang /
translated: delight and attachment to objects of work; delight and attachment to frivolous speech; delight and attachment to sleep; delight and attachment to seeking material things; delight and attachment to a good-looking form;🔽delight and attachment to pleasant sounds; delight and attachment to sweet smells; delight and attachment to delicious tastes; delight and attachment to soft textures; and delight and attachment to thoughts and analyses.

original: sgra snyan pa la dga' zhing chags pa dang / dri zhim po la dga' zhing chags pa dang / ro zhim po la dga' zhing chags pa dang / reg bya 'jam po la dga' zhing chags pa dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa la dga' zhing chags pa'o; ;tshangs pa chen po /
analyzed: sgra snyan pa la dga' zhing chags pa dang / dri zhim po la dga' zhing chags pa dang / ro zhim po la dga' zhing chags pa dang / reg bya 'jam po la dga' zhing chags pa dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa la dga' zhing chags pa'o; ;tshangs pa chen po /
translated: Mahābrahmā,

original: de ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: you should understand it in this way.

original: gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos rnam pa bcu po de ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dag spyod pa ngan pa 'di las 'ga' zhig dang ldan @212b na'ang ting nge 'dzin dag yongs su mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gnas pa dang / spyad par mi bya ba'i chos rnam pa bcu po de ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dag spyod pa ngan pa 'di las 'ga' zhig dang ldan @212b na'ang ting nge 'dzin dag yongs su mi 'grub bo //
translated: If one has any of these ten kinds of bad behavior, one will not succeed in the practice of meditation.

original: ji ste sngar grub na'ang de ma thag tu stor cing nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste sngar grub na'ang de ma thag tu stor cing nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one has previously succeeded, one will immediately lose it and fall back.

original: gal te ting nge 'dzin ma bsgrubs na dge ba'i tshogs gzhan ci bsags kyang de ni don du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ting nge 'dzin ma bsgrubs na dge ba'i tshogs gzhan ci bsags kyang de ni don du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not practice meditation, then no matter how much one accumulates other kinds of wholesome actions, it will not be of any use.

original: gang bdag gi longs spyod dang / dad pas sbyin pa bsgrub pa'i phyir sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos ngan pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang bdag gi longs spyod dang / dad pas sbyin pa bsgrub pa'i phyir sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos ngan pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because bad thoughts and mental states will arise, such as thoughts of one’s own wealth and enjoyment, and thoughts of the offerings of faith.

original: de'i rkyen gyis rgyal po dang; blon po chen po'i khrims dang yang 'gal bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis rgyal po dang; blon po chen po'i khrims dang yang 'gal bar byed do //
translated: Because of these conditions, one will violate the laws of the king and the great ministers.

original: kha cig la ni gshe shing spyod ba'ang byed do //
analyzed: kha cig la ni gshe shing spyod ba'ang byed do //
translated: One will also be abusive to some people.

original: kha cig la ni lcag gis gzhu ba dang / kha cig la ni lus kyi yan lag dang / nying lag gcod cing gcod par yang byed do //
analyzed: kha cig la ni lcag gis gzhu ba dang / kha cig la ni lus kyi yan lag dang / nying lag gcod cing gcod par yang byed do //
translated: Some are whipped, and some have their major and minor body parts cut off.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis nad drag pos 'debs shing yun ring por sdug bsngal myong ba dang / tshe thung ba dang / 'chi 'phos nas kyang ngan song gsum gang yang rung ba gcig gi nang du skye ba nas mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal ba'i bar du ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis nad drag pos 'debs shing yun ring por sdug bsngal myong ba dang / tshe thung ba dang / 'chi 'phos nas kyang ngan song gsum gang yang rung ba gcig gi nang du skye ba nas mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal ba'i bar du ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because of these causes and conditions, they are afflicted by severe illness and experience suffering for a long time, and after death and transmigration, they are born in any of the three lower realms, falling into the Avīci Hell.

original: ku dr'a ka dang / aa ra da ka dang / de shu ku ba la ki dang / lhas byin la sogs pa dang 'dra bar bsam gtan las nyams pa dang / mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal ba'i bar du ltung zhing rnam pa tshad med pa snyed kyi sdug bsngal chen po mi bzod pa kun myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ku dr'a ka dang / aa ra da ka dang / de shu ku ba la ki dang / lhas byin la sogs pa dang 'dra bar bsam gtan las nyams pa dang / mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal ba'i bar du ltung zhing rnam pa tshad med pa snyed kyi sdug bsngal chen po mi bzod pa kun myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Like Kūṭadanta, Ārāḍa, Śuka, and Devadatta, they fall from meditative concentration and fall into the Avīci Hell, experiencing immeasurable kinds of great suffering that are unbearable.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa cang shes koondi n+ya la 'di skad ces bka' stsal te //
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa cang shes koondi n+ya la 'di skad ces bka' stsal te //
translated: At that time, the World-Honored One said to the venerable Kaundinya:

original: khyod dang / bas mthar gnas shing ting nge 'dzin sgom pa'i dge slong @213a *//
analyzed: khyod dang / bas mthar gnas shing ting nge 'dzin sgom pa'i dge slong @213a *//
translated: “I allow those bhikṣus who dwell in remote places and cultivate samādhi,

original: dag gnas khang mchog dag na gnas shing mal cha mchog dang / kha zas mchog la spyod cing dge 'dun gyi las thams cad mi byed par gnang ngo //
analyzed: dag gnas khang mchog dag na gnas shing mal cha mchog dang / kha zas mchog la spyod cing dge 'dun gyi las thams cad mi byed par gnang ngo //
translated: while dwelling in the best dwellings, using the best bedding and food, and not performing all the Saṅgha’s duties.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dag gal te 'tsho ba'i yo byad kyis brel bar gyur na sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos ngan pa skye zhing ting nge 'dzin thams cad mi 'grub pa nas mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal ba'i bar du ltung zhing mi bzad pa'i sdug bsngal chen po rnam pa tshad med pa snyed myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dag gal te 'tsho ba'i yo byad kyis brel bar gyur na sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos ngan pa skye zhing ting nge 'dzin thams cad mi 'grub pa nas mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal ba'i bar du ltung zhing mi bzad pa'i sdug bsngal chen po rnam pa tshad med pa snyed myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If those cultivating samādhi are troubled by the requisites of life, then evil thoughts and mental factors arise, all samādhis are not accomplished, and one falls into the Avīci Hell and original: ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dag gal te 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang ldan na ting nge 'dzin mang po ma grub pa'ang grub pa dang / sngar grub pa dag kyang mi nyams so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dag gal te 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang ldan na ting nge 'dzin mang po ma grub pa'ang grub pa dang / sngar grub pa dag kyang mi nyams so //
translated: If those who cultivate meditative concentration have the requisites for sustenance, they will achieve meditative concentration that they have not achieved and they will not lose meditative concentration that they have achieved.

original: de'i dbang gis mi dge ba'i chos thams cad mi skye ba nas gzhung de bzhin du rgyas par mi dge ba'i rtog pa dang / dpyod pa'i bar du mi skye ba la mtho ris kyi lhar skye ba nas mya ngan 'da' ba'i bar du 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis mi dge ba'i chos thams cad mi skye ba nas gzhung de bzhin du rgyas par mi dge ba'i rtog pa dang / dpyod pa'i bar du mi skye ba la mtho ris kyi lhar skye ba nas mya ngan 'da' ba'i bar du 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of that, all nonvirtuous qualities will not arise, and so on, up to “nonvirtuous thoughts and reflections will not arise.”

original: ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dag gal te ting nge 'dzin mang po ma grub na nam gyi stod dang / nam gyi smad la mi nyal bar byas te brtson 'grus su bslab cing bsgom pa dang / 'du 'dzi yongs su spangs te 'dod pa nyung zhing chog shes par bya ba dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dag gal te ting nge 'dzin mang po ma grub na nam gyi stod dang / nam gyi smad la mi nyal bar byas te brtson 'grus su bslab cing bsgom pa dang / 'du 'dzi yongs su spangs te 'dod pa nyung zhing chog shes par bya ba dang /
translated: If those who cultivate meditative concentration have not achieved much meditative concentration, they should train in and cultivate effort by not lying down during the first and last periods of the night. They should avoid distractions, have few desires, and be content.

original: ci la'ang mi chags pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / khong khro ba dang / 'chab pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / phrag dog @213b dang; 'jungs pa dang / phra ma dang /
analyzed: ci la'ang mi chags pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / khong khro ba dang / 'chab pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / phrag dog @213b dang; 'jungs pa dang / phra ma dang /
translated: They are free from attachment to anything, and they abandon desire, anger, hostility, concealment, agitation, violence, pride, conceit, jealousy, stinginess,

original: ngag rtsub po dang / rdzun dang / 'jig rten gyi rtsod pa dang / bag med pa thams cad yongs su spong ngo //🔽gang de ltar nan tan byed pa de ni brgya byin dang; tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po la sogs pas bstod pa dang / bsngags pa dang / phyag dang / bsti stang dang / rim gro dang /
analyzed: ngag rtsub po dang / rdzun dang / 'jig rten gyi rtsod pa dang / bag med pa thams cad yongs su spong ngo // gang de ltar nan tan byed pa de ni brgya byin dang; tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po la sogs pas bstod pa dang / bsngags pa dang / phyag dang / bsti stang dang / rim gro dang /
translated: slander, harsh speech, lying, worldly disputes, and all carelessness.🔽Those who practice in this way will be praised, extolled, venerated, honored,

original: bsnyen bkur la sogs pa dang / sbyin pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong snyed kyang blang bar bya na /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur la sogs pa dang / sbyin pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong snyed kyang blang bar bya na /
translated: and served by Śakra, Brahmā, the four world guardians, the universal monarchs, and so forth, and they will receive hundreds of thousands of quintillions of offerings.

original: rgyal rigs dang / bram ze dang / rje'u rigs la sogs pa'i mchod pa len pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: rgyal rigs dang / bram ze dang / rje'u rigs la sogs pa'i mchod pa len pa lta ci smos /
translated: not to mention the offerings of the royalty, the brahmins, the merchants, and so on.

original: ting nge 'dzin ma thob pa dag kyang de dag gi bstod pa dang / bsngags pa dang / phyag dang / bkur sti dang / rim gro dang / bsnyen bkur dang / spyin pa dang / mchod pa bdag gir byed du dbang na ting nge 'dzin thob pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ma thob pa dag kyang de dag gi bstod pa dang / bsngags pa dang / phyag dang / bkur sti dang / rim gro dang / bsnyen bkur dang / spyin pa dang / mchod pa bdag gir byed du dbang na ting nge 'dzin thob pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If those who have not attained meditative concentration are able to accept the praise, the acclaim, the prostrations, the respect, the service, the veneration, the gifts, and the offerings of others, what need is there to speak of those who have attained meditative concentration?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke in verse:

original: ting 'dzin bsgoms pas the tshom gcod 'gyur te //
analyzed: ting 'dzin bsgoms pas the tshom gcod 'gyur te //
translated: “Meditative concentration eliminates doubt,

original: de ma gtogs par gzhan gyis nus ma yin //
analyzed: de ma gtogs par gzhan gyis nus ma yin //
translated: and nothing else can do that.

original: de bas ting 'dzin bsgom pa mchog yin gyi //
analyzed: de bas ting 'dzin bsgom pa mchog yin gyi //
translated: Therefore, meditative concentration is supreme,

original: mkhas pa dag gis de la mchod pa bya //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag gis de la mchod pa bya //
translated: and the wise should venerate it.

original: de nas tshangs pa chen po lha'i snying pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa chen po lha'i snying pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Mahābrahmā Hṛī said this:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Respected Blessed One,

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ba dag gal te rgyal rigs sam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ba dag gal te rgyal rigs sam /
translated: If those who have gone forth in the Buddha’s teachings are beaten with whips, sticks, and so forth by members of the ruling class,

original: blon po chen po'am /🔽dbang pos lcag dang / dbyug pa la sogs pas gzhus sam /
analyzed: blon po chen po'am / dbang pos lcag dang / dbyug pa la sogs pas gzhus sam /
translated: great ministers,🔽or the king’s men,

original: brdegs @214a *// sam; gal te btson rar bcug gam /🔽spyos sam / brgyad dam /
analyzed: brdegs @214a *// sam; gal te btson rar bcug gam / spyos sam / brgyad dam /
translated: or if they are imprisoned,🔽scolding, beaten,

original: yan lag gtubs sam /
analyzed: yan lag gtubs sam /
translated: or their limbs are cut off,

original: srog dang phral te bkum na de ci rigs pa lags sam /
analyzed: srog dang phral te bkum na de ci rigs pa lags sam /
translated: or if they are killed and their lives taken, is that right or not?

original: 'on te rigs par ma lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa chen po lha'i snying po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'on te rigs par ma lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa chen po lha'i snying po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Is that right or not?”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: The Blessed One said to Mahābrahma God’s Essence, “Noble son,

original: sems can gang zhig nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas skra dang / kha spu bregs te /
analyzed: sems can gang zhig nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas skra dang / kha spu bregs te /
translated: if someone has gone forth in my teachings, shaved their head and beard,

original: ngur smrig gi tshal bu gyon na tshul khrims srung ngam /
analyzed: ngur smrig gi tshal bu gyon na tshul khrims srung ngam /
translated: and put on saffron robes, whether they keep the precepts

original: tshul khrims nyams sam /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams sam /
translated: or violate the precepts,

original: tshul khrims med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims med kyang rung ste /
translated: or even if they have no precepts,

original: de la lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin la sogs pa thams cad kyis kyang khyim pa'i chos nyid dang sbyar du'ang mi gnang na /🔽de la lcag dang / dbyig pa la sogs pas lus la gzhu zhing 'tshog pa dang / btson rar gzhug pa dang / gshe ba dang / spyo ba dang / lus kyi yan lag gtub pa dang / 'tsho ba'i dbang po dang phral ba /
analyzed: de la lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin la sogs pa thams cad kyis kyang khyim pa'i chos nyid dang sbyar du'ang mi gnang na / de la lcag dang / dbyig pa la sogs pas lus la gzhu zhing 'tshog pa dang / btson rar gzhug pa dang / gshe ba dang / spyo ba dang / lus kyi yan lag gtub pa dang / 'tsho ba'i dbang po dang phral ba /
translated: Even the gods, humans, asuras, and so forth will not allow him to be treated according to the laws of a householder.

original: chos ma yin pa dang sbyor ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang sbyor ba lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to speak of applying the laws of non-Dharma to him?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: tshul khrims srung zhing mang du thos pa dang ldan pa lta zhog la /
analyzed: tshul khrims srung zhing mang du thos pa dang ldan pa lta zhog la /
translated: Forget about those who keep ethical discipline and are learned.

original: nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas tshul khrims nyams te mi dge ba'i chos spyod pas nang rul cing mi gtsang bas gang ba'i srin kva lva dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas tshul khrims nyams te mi dge ba'i chos spyod pas nang rul cing mi gtsang bas gang ba'i srin kva lva dang 'dra ba /
translated: Those who have gone forth in my teachings, who have broken their ethical discipline and engage in non-virtuous dharmas, are like maggots, their insides filled with the filth of their own impurities.

original: dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba /
analyzed: dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba /
translated: They are not mendicants but pretend to be mendicants.

original: tshangs par spyod pa ma yin par tshangs par spyod par khas 'che ba /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ma yin par tshangs par spyod par khas 'che ba /
translated: He is not celibate, yet he claims to be.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs las pham pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs las pham pa /
translated: He is defeated by the various afflictions.

original: @214b zhig pa /
analyzed: @214b zhig pa /
translated: He is fallen,🔽degraded.

original: khas bub pa de lta bu'i tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong ngan pa'ang lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang /
analyzed: khas bub pa de lta bu'i tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong ngan pa'ang lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang /
translated: Such a monk with degenerate morality is a bad monk, yet he is the teacher and guide of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans,

original: mi ma yin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi ston pa dang / 'dren par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi ston pa dang / 'dren par 'gyur te /
translated: non-humans, and so forth.

original: yon tan rin po che dpag tu med pa'i gter du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan rin po che dpag tu med pa'i gter du 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes a treasure of immeasurable precious qualities.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu; nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba dag tshul khrims nyams kyang sems can dag gzugs mthong ba tsam gyis lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam pa bcu skye bas na yon tan rin po che'i phung po dpag tu med pa bcu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu; nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba dag tshul khrims nyams kyang sems can dag gzugs mthong ba tsam gyis lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam pa bcu skye bas na yon tan rin po che'i phung po dpag tu med pa bcu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, son of noble family, even if those who have gone forth in my teachings have impaired discipline, because sentient beings give rise to ten kinds of superior thoughts merely by seeing their form, they will obtain ten immeasurable heaps of precious qualities.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba dag tshul khrims nyams mod kyi /
analyzed: nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba dag tshul khrims nyams mod kyi /
translated: Even if those who have gone forth in my teachings have impaired discipline,

original: sems can dag gis mthong bar gyur na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pas bkur sti dang bcas pas dang cing gus pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa skye'o //
analyzed: sems can dag gis mthong bar gyur na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pas bkur sti dang bcas pas dang cing gus pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa skye'o //
translated: when sentient beings see them, they give rise to the superior thought of respect and devotion, recollecting the Buddha.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis mu stegs can gyi ston pa dang / de'i gtsug lag dang / de'i 'khor la nam du'ang mi phyogs pa nas 'jigs pa dang bral ba yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis mu stegs can gyi ston pa dang / de'i gtsug lag dang / de'i 'khor la nam du'ang mi phyogs pa nas 'jigs pa dang bral ba yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: By that cause and that condition, they will never turn to the teachers of the tīrthikas, their scriptures, or their retinue, and will enter the great city of liberation, free from fear.

original: la las mthong nas 'phags pa'i tshul khrims rjes su dran pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa skye'o //🔽de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis srog gcod pa yongs su spong ba dang / ma byin par len pa yongs su spong ba dang / 'dod pas log par @215a *//
analyzed: la las mthong nas 'phags pa'i tshul khrims rjes su dran pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa skye'o // de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis srog gcod pa yongs su spong ba dang / ma byin par len pa yongs su spong ba dang / 'dod pas log par @215a *//
translated: Some, seeing this, give rise to the superior intention to recollect the noble morality.

original: g-yem pa yongs su spong ba dang / brdzun du smra ba yongs su spong ba dang / bag med pa'i gnas smyo ba'i khu ba chang la sogs pa 'thung ba yongs su spong ba nas 'jigs pa dang bral ba yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yem pa yongs su spong ba dang / brdzun du smra ba yongs su spong ba dang / bag med pa'i gnas smyo ba'i khu ba chang la sogs pa 'thung ba yongs su spong ba nas 'jigs pa dang bral ba yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: For that cause and that condition, they give up killing, give up stealing, give up sexual misconduct, give up lying, give up drinking alcohol and other intoxicants that cause heedlessness, up to giving up the abode of fear and entering the great city of nirvāṇa.

original: la las mthong nas sbyin pa rjes su dran pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa skye'o //
analyzed: la las mthong nas sbyin pa rjes su dran pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa skye'o //
translated: Some, seeing this, give rise to the superior intention to recollect generosity.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyi longs spyod chen po dang ldan zhing yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spyod pa can la mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa nas 'jigs pa dang bral ba yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyi longs spyod chen po dang ldan zhing yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spyod pa can la mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa nas 'jigs pa dang bral ba yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: Through that cause and that condition, they will have great wealth, and will be endowed with right and right conduct, and will make offerings and service to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha, and will enter the great city of nirvāṇa free from fear.

original: la las mthong nas ngang des pa'i bzod pa rjes su dran pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa skye'o //
analyzed: la las mthong nas ngang des pa'i bzod pa rjes su dran pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa skye'o //
translated: Some, having seen that, will arouse the higher intention of recollecting the patient acceptance of gentleness.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis phra ma yongs su spong ba dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa dang / zhe sdang yongs su spong ba nas 'jigs pa dang bral ba yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis phra ma yongs su spong ba dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa dang / zhe sdang yongs su spong ba nas 'jigs pa dang bral ba yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: Through that cause and that condition, they will completely abandon slander, harsh speech, and idle talk, and will completely abandon hatred, and will enter the great city of nirvāṇa free from fear.

original: la las mthong nas rab tu 'byung zhing brtson 'grus la nan tan bya bar rjes su dran pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa skye'o //
analyzed: la las mthong nas rab tu 'byung zhing brtson 'grus la nan tan bya bar rjes su dran pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa skye'o //
translated: Some, having seen that, will arouse the higher intention of recollecting going forth and being diligent.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis khyim rab tu spong zhing khyim ma yin pa'i chos len te shin tu 'bad pa'i brtson 'grus kyis spyod pa'i mchog nan tan byed pa nas 'jigs pa med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i grong khyer chen @215b po la 'jug pa'i🔽bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis khyim rab tu spong zhing khyim ma yin pa'i chos len te shin tu 'bad pa'i brtson 'grus kyis spyod pa'i mchog nan tan byed pa nas 'jigs pa med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i grong khyer chen @215b po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: By this cause and this condition, they abandon the household and take up the Dharma of the non-householder. From the supreme practice of diligence with utmost effort, up to entering the great city of fearlessness, the transcendence of suffering.

original: la las mthong nas 'khrug pa'i sems yongs su spong zhing bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhog pa rjes su dran pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa skye'o //
analyzed: la las mthong nas 'khrug pa'i sems yongs su spong zhing bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhog pa rjes su dran pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa skye'o //
translated: Some, having seen and abandoned the agitated mind, recollect and generate the superior intention to enter meditative concentration.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis ri dang / tshal dang / bas mtha' dgon pa la mos shing nyin mtshan du ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la brtson 'grus rtsom pa nas 'jigs pa med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis ri dang / tshal dang / bas mtha' dgon pa la mos shing nyin mtshan du ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la brtson 'grus rtsom pa nas 'jigs pa med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: By this cause and this condition, they aspire to mountains, forests, and remote wildernesses, and from striving in cultivating meditative concentration day and night, up to entering the great city of fearlessness, the transcendence of suffering.

original: la las mthong nas shes rab rjes su dran pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa skye'o //
analyzed: la las mthong nas shes rab rjes su dran pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa skye'o //
translated: Some, seeing this, will develop the higher intention to recollect wisdom.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / klog pa dang; 'don pa la dga' zhing spro ba nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / klog pa dang; 'don pa la dga' zhing spro ba nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: Through that cause and that condition, they will delight in listening to, reading, and reciting the sublime Dharma, up to entering the great city of nirvana.

original: la las mthong nas yang dag par 'byung ba dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon bskyed par rjes su dran pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa skye ba nas 'dzum bzhin du smra ba dang / spro bzhin du gtam zer ba dang /  rkang pa la phyag 'tshal ba'i bar du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la las mthong nas yang dag par 'byung ba dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon bskyed par rjes su dran pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa skye ba nas 'dzum bzhin du smra ba dang / spro bzhin du gtam zer ba dang /  rkang pa la phyag 'tshal ba'i bar du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some, seeing this, will develop the higher intention to recollect the roots of virtue that have previously arisen, up to smiling, speaking joyfully, and bowing at the feet.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis rigs che zhing mtho pa dang / btsun pa'i rigs su skye zhing sems can tshad med pa kun gyis mthong na dga' ba nas 'jigs pa dang bral ba yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis rigs che zhing mtho pa dang / btsun pa'i rigs su skye zhing sems can tshad med pa kun gyis mthong na dga' ba nas 'jigs pa dang bral ba yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: and into a family of high status, and will be loved by all beings, and will enter the great city of nirvana, which is free from fear.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba dag tshul khrims nyams kyang sems can dag gzugs dang / cha lugs mthong ba tsam gyis lhag @216a *//
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba dag tshul khrims nyams kyang sems can dag gzugs dang / cha lugs mthong ba tsam gyis lhag @216a *//
translated: Son of noble family,

original: pa'i bsam pa rnam pa 'di bcu skye ste /
analyzed: pa'i bsam pa rnam pa 'di bcu skye ste /
translated: even if those who have gone forth in my teachings have damaged their discipline, beings will give rise to the ten superior thoughts merely by seeing their form and attire,

original: yon tan rin po che'i phung po tshad med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan rin po che'i phung po tshad med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will obtain an immeasurable heap of precious qualities.

original: de bas na rgyal po dang / blon po chen po dang / dbang po la sogs pas de la lcag dang / dbyig pa la sogs pas gzhu zhing 'tshog pa dang / btson rar gzhug pa dang / gshe zhing spyo ba dang / lus kyi yan lag gtub pa dang /
analyzed: de bas na rgyal po dang / blon po chen po dang / dbang po la sogs pas de la lcag dang / dbyig pa la sogs pas gzhu zhing 'tshog pa dang / btson rar gzhug pa dang / gshe zhing spyo ba dang / lus kyi yan lag gtub pa dang /
translated: Therefore, it is not right for kings, great ministers, and the like to beat them with whips, clubs, and so on, to imprison them, to scold and revile them, to cut off their limbs,

original: 'tsho ba'i dbang po dang bral ba la sogs pa bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i dbang po dang bral ba la sogs pa bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: or to deprive them of their life.

original: gzhan yang / tshangs pa chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / tshangs pa chen po /
translated: Moreover, Great Brahmā,

original: nga la skyabs su song ste /
analyzed: nga la skyabs su song ste /
translated: those who have gone for refuge to me

original: rab tu byung ba dag tshul khrims nyams te mi dge ba'i chos spyod pa nang rul cing mi gtsang bas gang ba'i srin kva lva dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dag tshul khrims nyams te mi dge ba'i chos spyod pa nang rul cing mi gtsang bas gang ba'i srin kva lva dang 'dra ba /
translated: and have gone forth, who have violated their ethics and engage in nonvirtuous qualities, who are like maggots filled with the stench of their own filth,

original: dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba /
analyzed: dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba /
translated: who are not ascetics but claim to be ascetics,

original: tshangs par spyod pa ma yin par tshangs par spyod pa khas 'che ba /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ma yin par tshangs par spyod pa khas 'che ba /
translated: who are not celibate but claim to be celibate,

original: nyon mongs pa rnam pa mang po las pham pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa mang po las pham pa /
translated: who have been defeated by the many afflictions,

original: rul pa / khas bub pa lta bu'i dge slong tshul khrims nyams te mi dge ba spyod med kyi /
analyzed: rul pa / khas bub pa lta bu'i dge slong tshul khrims nyams te mi dge ba spyod med kyi /
translated: Even if a monk is corrupt,

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang; mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi ston pa dang /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang; mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi ston pa dang /
translated: with his head hanging low, and his discipline ruined, he is still a field of merit for gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, humans, non-humans, and so forth.

original: 'dren pa'i dge ba'i gshes gnyen byed cing yon tan dpag tu med pa'i gter du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dren pa'i dge ba'i gshes gnyen byed cing yon tan dpag tu med pa'i gter du 'gyur ro //
translated: He is a teacher and a spiritual friend who guides them all. He is a treasure of immeasurable good qualities.

original: de ltar dge slong de chos kyi snod ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar dge slong de chos kyi snod ma yin mod kyi /
translated: “Even though such a monk is not a vessel for the Dharma,

original: skra dang / kha spu bregs te gos ngur smrig gyon nas cha lugs dang / spyod lam 'phags pa rnams dang mthun te /
analyzed: skra dang / kha spu bregs te gos ngur smrig gyon nas cha lugs dang / spyod lam 'phags pa rnams dang mthun te /
translated: he shaves his head and face and dons the saffron robes. He is in accord with the noble ones in his appearance and conduct.

original: @216b de mthong ba tsam gyis sems can tshad med pa rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'phel zhing skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @216b de mthong ba tsam gyis sems can tshad med pa rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'phel zhing skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Merely by seeing him, the roots of virtue of countless beings increase and grow.

original: gzhan yang / sems can tshad med pa rnams mtho ris kyi lhar skye ba dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i yang dag pa'i lam la 'dzud par 'gyur te /🔽de bas na nga la skyabs su song ste rab tu byung ba dag tshul khrims srung ngam /
analyzed: gzhan yang / sems can tshad med pa rnams mtho ris kyi lhar skye ba dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i yang dag pa'i lam la 'dzud par 'gyur te / de bas na nga la skyabs su song ste rab tu byung ba dag tshul khrims srung ngam /
translated: they will lead countless sentient beings to be born as gods in the higher realms and to enter the true path to nirvāṇa.

original: tshul khrims nyams sam /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams sam /
translated: Therefore, those who have gone for refuge to me and have become renunciates, whether they keep the precepts or violate them,

original: tshul khrims med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims med kyang rung ste /
translated: whether they have precepts or not,

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'am /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'am /
translated: whether they are universal monarchs,

original: rgyal po gzhan nam /
analyzed: rgyal po gzhan nam /
translated: other kings,

original: blon po la sogs pas khyim pa'i chos nyid dang sbyor du'ang ma gnang na /
analyzed: blon po la sogs pas khyim pa'i chos nyid dang sbyor du'ang ma gnang na /
translated: or ministers, and so on, should not be allowed to be bound by the laws of householders.

original: lcag dang / dbyig pa la sogs pas gzhu ba dang; 'tshog pa dang / btson rar gzhug pa dang / gshe zhing spyo pa dang / lus kyi yan lag dang / nying lag gcod cing gtub pa dang / 'tsho ba'i dbang po dang bral ba la sogs pa chos ma yin pa gzhan lta ci smos /
analyzed: lcag dang / dbyig pa la sogs pas gzhu ba dang; 'tshog pa dang / btson rar gzhug pa dang / gshe zhing spyo pa dang / lus kyi yan lag dang / nying lag gcod cing gtub pa dang / 'tsho ba'i dbang po dang bral ba la sogs pa chos ma yin pa gzhan lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention other unrighteous acts, such as beating, striking, imprisoning, scolding, and reproaching them, cutting off their major and minor body parts, and depriving them of their life force?

original: tshangs pa chen po /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po /
translated: Great Brahmā,

original: de ltar tshul khrims nyams shing sdig pa spyod pa'i dge slong de ngas bstan pa'i 'dul ba las mi ro lta bu'o zhes gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims nyams shing sdig pa spyod pa'i dge slong de ngas bstan pa'i 'dul ba las mi ro lta bu'o zhes gsungs mod kyi /
translated: The Buddha said, The monk who has violated morality and who practices evil is like a corpse in my teachings on the Vinaya.

original: rab tu byung ba dang / tshul khrims dang / yon tan lhag ma'i mthu yod do //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dang / tshul khrims dang / yon tan lhag ma'i mthu yod do //
translated: However, he has the power of his ordination, morality, and other good qualities.

original: dper na / khyu mchog gam /
analyzed: dper na / khyu mchog gam /
translated: For example, a bull

original: gla ba lta bu shi ste rnam par shes pa dang bral nas byol song gi nang na ro yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gla ba lta bu shi ste rnam par shes pa dang bral nas byol song gi nang na ro yin mod kyi /
translated: or musk deer dies and, when separated from consciousness, is a corpse among animals.

original: khyu mchog la gi wang yod pa dang / gla ba la gla rtsi yod pas sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa'i phan pa dang / bde ba'i don chen por 'gyur ba bzhin du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge @217a *//
analyzed: khyu mchog la gi wang yod pa dang / gla ba la gla rtsi yod pas sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa'i phan pa dang / bde ba'i don chen por 'gyur ba bzhin du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge @217a *//
translated: However, because the bull has bile and the musk deer has musk, they become of great benefit and happiness for countless, limitless sentient beings.

original: slong de'ang ngas bstan pa'i 'dul ba las mi ro lta bu'o zhes bya mod kyi /
analyzed: slong de'ang ngas bstan pa'i 'dul ba las mi ro lta bu'o zhes bya mod kyi /
translated: Similarly, the monk who has violated morality is like a corpse in my teachings on the Vinaya.

original: rab tu byung ba dang / tshul khrims dang / yon tan lhag ma'i mthus kyang sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dang / tshul khrims dang / yon tan lhag ma'i mthus kyang sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also of great benefit and happiness to countless sentient beings through the power of going forth, moral discipline, and other excellent qualities.

original: tshangs pa chen po /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po /
translated: Great Brahmā,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: tshong pa dag kyang rgya mtsho chen por zhugs nas rigs gcig pa'i sems can tshad med pa dag bsad de mig phyung nas mig gi 'bras bu de dang / brtan zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu dang lhan cig sbyar na mig sman rin po cher 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshong pa dag kyang rgya mtsho chen por zhugs nas rigs gcig pa'i sems can tshad med pa dag bsad de mig phyung nas mig gi 'bras bu de dang / brtan zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu dang lhan cig sbyar na mig sman rin po cher 'gyur ro //
translated: Merchants who enter the great ocean kill countless beings of the same kind, gouge out their eyes, and mix the eye-balls with the product called firm.

original: sems can gang long ba mig med pa mngal nas phyung nas dmus long du gyur pa dag gi mig tu rin po che'i mig sman des byugs na mig nad thams cad dang bral te mig rno zhing gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gang long ba mig med pa mngal nas phyung nas dmus long du gyur pa dag gi mig tu rin po che'i mig sman des byugs na mig nad thams cad dang bral te mig rno zhing gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that precious eye medicine is applied to the eyes of sentient beings who are blind from birth, all eye diseases are removed and the eyes become sharp and clear.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong yang ngas bstan pa'i 'dul ba las mi ro lta bu zhes bya mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong yang ngas bstan pa'i 'dul ba las mi ro lta bu zhes bya mod kyi /
translated: Likewise, I have said that a monk who has broken his moral discipline is like a corpse in the midst of the monastic community.

original: rab tu byung ba'i spyod lam dang / cha lugs yod pas sems can  tshad med pa dag gis skad cig mthong ba tsam gyis kyang rnam par dag pa'i shes rab kyi mig thob par 'gyur na pha rol po gzhan la dam pa'i chos ston nus pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i spyod lam dang / cha lugs yod pas sems can  tshad med pa dag gis skad cig mthong ba tsam gyis kyang rnam par dag pa'i shes rab kyi mig thob par 'gyur na pha rol po gzhan la dam pa'i chos ston nus pa lta ci smos /
translated: However, if simply seeing the deportment and attire of one who has gone forth causes immeasurable beings to obtain the eye of pure wisdom, what need is there to speak of someone who is able to teach the sublime Dharma to others?

original: tshangs pa chen po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po 'di lta ste /
translated: “Mahābrahmā, it is like this:

original: bdug spos bsregs na spos nyid tshig ste med par song yang dri bsung gis gzhan la bro bar byed de //
analyzed: bdug spos bsregs na spos nyid tshig ste med par song yang dri bsung gis gzhan la bro bar byed de //
translated: When incense is burned, the incense itself is consumed and disappears, but its fragrance spreads to others.

original: de bas na /

translated: They are not allowed to participate in the confession ceremony in the midst of the pure Sangha, nor to enter or leave the Sangha, nor to be expelled from the Sangha.🔽They are not allowed to enjoy any of the offerings, possessions, or property of the Sangha of the four directions, nor the food, drink, or provisions for life.

translated: They are not allowed to participate in any of the activities of the monastic discipline. They are not allowed to be beaten, struck, bound, or deprived of their life.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /

translated: They are intentionally killing one’s father, intentionally killing one’s mother, intentionally killing an arhat, causing a schism in the community of monks, and with evil intent causing a buddha to bleed.

analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i na ngan kha na mtho bo'i las yin pos nyes pa'i rtsa ba yin no / ngan par lta bas 'dum pa'i dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa ste /

analyzed: gang zag gang zhig mtshams med pa'i khan ma thob chen po'i las dang nye ba rnam pa bzhi po 'di las gcig tsam byas na rab tu 'byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs su mi gnang ste /
