analyzed: de ni rtsa ba'i sdig kyang ma yin la mtshams med pa'ang ma yin te / kha nam thob che po'i las mtshams med pa dang nye ba @220a *//
translated: that is not even a root transgression, let alone a heinous act.🔽It is called a heinous act similar to a heinous act.

original: zhes bya'o // gang zag de kha na mtho ba'i sdig pa'i las chen po dag mthol ba dang / bshags pa ma byas kyi bar du rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs su mi rung ste /🔽la la zhig gis rab tu phyung nga /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // gang zag de kha na mtho ba'i sdig pa'i las chen po dag mthol ba dang / bshags pa ma byas kyi bar du rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs su mi rung ste / la la zhig gis rab tu phyung nga /
translated: For as long as that person does not confess and reveal the great evil of a heinous act, they are not suitable to go forth and receive full ordination.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa byin na /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa byin na /
translated: If someone were to give the going forth and full ordination to such a person,🔽what would be the consequence?🔽The Blessed One said, That preceptor or teacher would commit an offense.

original: de'i slob dpon de sdig pa dang bcas pa yin pas nga'i bstan pa las bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i slob dpon de sdig pa dang bcas pa yin pas nga'i bstan pa las bskrad par bya'o //
translated: Since that teacher is sinful, he should be expelled from my teaching.

original: gang zag de rab tu byung ngam bsnyen par rdzogs nas kha na ma tho ba'i sdig ba de mthol ba dang / bshags pa'i las ma byas na de ni ngas bstan pa'i 'dul ba las myur du bsgrad dgos so //
analyzed: gang zag de rab tu byung ngam bsnyen par rdzogs nas kha na ma tho ba'i sdig ba de mthol ba dang / bshags pa'i las ma byas na de ni ngas bstan pa'i 'dul ba las myur du bsgrad dgos so //
translated: If that person, having gone forth or been ordained, does not perform the action of confessing and revealing that blameworthy sin, then he should be quickly expelled from my teaching and training.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang zag rnam pa de gnyis ni dam pa'i chos kyi mig med par byed pa /
analyzed: gang zag rnam pa de gnyis ni dam pa'i chos kyi mig med par byed pa /
translated: Those two kinds of persons are the ones who make the eye of the sublime Dharma disappear.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi sgron ma nub par byed pa /🔽dkon mchog gi gdung yongs su gcod pa ste lha dang / mi la sogs pas don med pa /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi sgron ma nub par byed pa / dkon mchog gi gdung yongs su gcod pa ste lha dang / mi la sogs pas don med pa /
translated: They are the ones who make the lamp of the sublime Dharma disappear.🔽They are the ones who cut off the lineage of the Three Jewels. They are the ones who lead gods and humans and so on to meaningless and useless suffering.

original: phan pa med pa'i sdug bsngal spyod du 'dzug cing ngan song du ltung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phan pa med pa'i sdug bsngal spyod du 'dzug cing ngan song du ltung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: They are the ones who cause them to fall into the lower realms.

original: gang zag rnam pa gnyis po de ni bdag nyid kyi dam pa'i chos la skur cing 'phags pa rnam la smon pa yin la /
analyzed: gang zag rnam pa gnyis po de ni bdag nyid kyi dam pa'i chos la skur cing 'phags pa rnam la smon pa yin la /
translated: Those two kinds of persons are the ones who deprecate the sublime Dharma and slander noble beings.

original: pha rol po gzhan dag kyang dam pa'i chos la skur cing 'phags pa rnams la smod du 'dzud pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol po gzhan dag kyang dam pa'i chos la skur cing 'phags pa rnams la smod du 'dzud pa ste /
translated: They also cause others to disparage the sublime Dharma and denigrate noble beings.

original: tshe 'phos ma thag tu mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por ltung zhing bskal ba'i bar du sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur te phyir gsor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tshe 'phos ma thag tu mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por ltung zhing bskal ba'i bar du sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur te phyir gsor mi rung ngo //
translated: As soon as they die, they will fall into the great hells of immediate retribution and experience suffering for an eon, which cannot be cured.

original: tshangs pa chen po /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po /
translated: Great Brahmā,

original: gzhan yang / bcas pa'i sdig la mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba'ang yod @220b la; rang bzhin gyi sdig la mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba'ang yod /
analyzed: gzhan yang / bcas pa'i sdig la mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba'ang yod @220b la; rang bzhin gyi sdig la mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba'ang yod /
translated: Moreover, there are things that are not to be done and that do not constitute natural misdeeds, and there are things that are not to be done and that do not constitute natural misdeeds.

original: rang bzhin gyi sdig la rtsa ba'i sdig tu 'gyur ba mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba'ang yod do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi sdig la rtsa ba'i sdig tu 'gyur ba mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba'ang yod do //
translated: There are things that are not to be done and that do not constitute natural misdeeds, and there are things that are not to be done and that do not constitute natural misdeeds.

original: de la ji ltar na rtsa ba'i sdig la mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba'i chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na rtsa ba'i sdig la mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba'i chos gang zhe na /
translated: What are the things that are not to be done and that do not constitute natural misdeeds?

original: 'di ltar ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dge slong gang zhig mi tshangs par spyod pas rtsa ba'i sdig byas pa dang ched du bsams te /
analyzed: dge slong gang zhig mi tshangs par spyod pas rtsa ba'i sdig byas pa dang ched du bsams te /
translated: If a bhikṣu commits a natural misdeed by engaging in sexual activity, he should be expelled.

original: skye bo mi'i srog bcad nas rtsa ba'i sdig byas pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor ma byin pa brkus nas rtsa ba'i sdig byas pa dang / rdzun chen po smras nas rtsa ba'i sdig byas pa ste /
analyzed: skye bo mi'i srog bcad nas rtsa ba'i sdig byas pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor ma byin pa brkus nas rtsa ba'i sdig byas pa dang / rdzun chen po smras nas rtsa ba'i sdig byas pa ste /
translated: If a person kills another human being, he commits a root downfall. If he steals the property of the Three Jewels, he commits a root downfall. If he lies about his spiritual attainments, he commits a root downfall.

original: dge slong gang zhig rtsa ba'i sdig rnam pa 'di bzhi las 'ga' zhig byas na dge slong gis las bya ba'i nang du mi chud de /
analyzed: dge slong gang zhig rtsa ba'i sdig rnam pa 'di bzhi las 'ga' zhig byas na dge slong gis las bya ba'i nang du mi chud de /
translated: If a monk commits any of these four root downfalls, he is no longer considered a monk.

original: longs spyod thams cad dang / phyogs bzha'i dge 'dun gyi nor la spyod du mi dbang mod kyi /
analyzed: longs spyod thams cad dang / phyogs bzha'i dge 'dun gyi nor la spyod du mi dbang mod kyi /
translated: He is not allowed to enjoy any of the possessions of the Sangha or to share in the offerings made to the Sangha.

original: de la'ang dbyig pa dang / lcag gis brdeg cing gzhu ba dang / btson rar gzhug pa dang / spyi zhing gshe ba dang lus kyi yan lag gtub pa dang / 'tsho ba'i dbang po dang phral ba la sogs pa thams cad byed du mi gnang ngo //
analyzed: de la'ang dbyig pa dang / lcag gis brdeg cing gzhu ba dang / btson rar gzhug pa dang / spyi zhing gshe ba dang lus kyi yan lag gtub pa dang / 'tsho ba'i dbang po dang phral ba la sogs pa thams cad byed du mi gnang ngo //
translated: He is not allowed to be beaten, whipped, imprisoned, verbally abused, tortured, or killed.

original: de dag ni rang bzhin gyi sdig gi nad na rtsa ba'i sdig lce'i ba ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rang bzhin gyi sdig gi nad na rtsa ba'i sdig lce'i ba ste /
translated: These are the four root downfalls that are by nature downfalls.

original: mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “non-abiding” and “non-action.”

original: ci'i phyir de la rtsa ba'i sdig ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la rtsa ba'i sdig ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called “fundamental transgression”?

original: gang zag gang gis chos rnam pa de bzhin byas na /
analyzed: gang zag gang gis chos rnam pa de bzhin byas na /
translated: If a person commits such an act,

original: tshe 'phos ma thag tu ngan song du ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe 'phos ma thag tu ngan song du ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: immediately after death he will fall into the evil destinies.

original: ngan song du 'gro ba'i rtsa ba yin pas na rtsa ba'i sdig ces bya'o //🔽de la ci'i phyir mtshams med pa dang / mtshams @221a *//
analyzed: ngan song du 'gro ba'i rtsa ba yin pas na rtsa ba'i sdig ces bya'o // de la ci'i phyir mtshams med pa dang / mtshams @221a *//
translated: Because it is the root of going to the evil destinies, it is called “fundamental transgression.”

original: med pa la nye ba dang / rtsa ba'i sdig pa mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba'i kha na mtho ba chen po'i las ngan pa zhes gsungs zhe na /
analyzed: med pa la nye ba dang / rtsa ba'i sdig pa mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba'i kha na mtho ba chen po'i las ngan pa zhes gsungs zhe na /
translated: Why is it called “immediate offense,” “offense similar to an immediate offense,” and “fundamental transgression,” and also called “non-abiding” and “great offense of non-action”?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son!

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: lcags kyi thu lus mam /
analyzed: lcags kyi thu lus mam /
translated: If an iron ball

original: ro nye'i dbu ni steng gi nam mkha' la bor na cung zad kyang mi sdod par de mthag tu phyi yang sa la ltung ngo //
analyzed: ro nye'i dbu ni steng gi nam mkha' la bor na cung zad kyang mi sdod par de mthag tu phyi yang sa la ltung ngo //
translated: is thrown into the air above, it will not stay in the air for even a moment, but will immediately fall to the ground.

original: mtshams med pa lnga dang / mtshams med pa la nye ba dang / rtsa ba'i sdig bzhi dang / dam pa'i chos la skur ba dang / dkon mchog gsum la the tshom za ba dang / gang zag sdig ba na rnam gnyis po'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga dang / mtshams med pa la nye ba dang / rtsa ba'i sdig bzhi dang / dam pa'i chos la skur ba dang / dkon mchog gsum la the tshom za ba dang / gang zag sdig ba na rnam gnyis po'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The five heinous crimes, the five crimes that are similar to the heinous crimes, the four root downfalls, the denial of the holy Dharma, doubt with regard to the Three Jewels, and the two kinds of persons who are like posts—

original: gang zag gang gi sdig pa rnam pa bcu gcig po de las 'ga' zhig byas na tshe 'phos ma thag tu thogs pa med par mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por gdon mi za bar skye zhing sdug bsngal chen po myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zag gang gi sdig pa rnam pa bcu gcig po de las 'ga' zhig byas na tshe 'phos ma thag tu thogs pa med par mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por gdon mi za bar skye zhing sdug bsngal chen po myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: if you commit any of these eleven kinds of evil deeds, you will certainly be reborn in the great hells that are the inevitable consequences of your actions, and you will experience great suffering.

original: de bas na mi gnas pa dang mi bya ba'i kha na ma tho ba chen po'i las ngan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi gnas pa dang mi bya ba'i kha na ma tho ba chen po'i las ngan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, these are called “evil actions that are great offenses that should not be done and should not be committed.”

original: mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba'i kha na mtho ba chen po las ngan pa 'di dag byas pa'i gang zag ni lus 'di nyid la nyon mongs pa zad par byed mi nus su nges re /
analyzed: mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba'i kha na mtho ba chen po las ngan pa 'di dag byas pa'i gang zag ni lus 'di nyid la nyon mongs pa zad par byed mi nus su nges re /
translated: If you commit these evil actions that are great offenses that should not be done and should not be committed, you will certainly not be able to eliminate your afflictions in this lifetime.

original: ting nge 'dzin yang mi'i grub na yang dag pa mi 'gyur ba la zhugs pa thob pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang mi'i grub na yang dag pa mi 'gyur ba la zhugs pa thob pa lta ci smos te /
translated: If even the attainment of concentration is not genuine, what need is there to speak of the attainment of the unchangeable?

original: tshe 'phos ma thag tu gdon mi za bar sems can dmyal bar skye zhing sdug bsngal chen bo myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'phos ma thag tu gdon mi za bar sems can dmyal bar skye zhing sdug bsngal chen bo myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Immediately after death, he will certainly be born in the hells and will experience great suffering.

original: tshangs pa chen po /🔽gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po / gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Great Brahmā,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis bsam @221b ba dag pas nga'i bstan pa la dad nas nyan thos kyi theg pa la zhugs sam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis bsam @221b ba dag pas nga'i bstan pa la dad nas nyan thos kyi theg pa la zhugs sam /
translated: Moreover, a son or daughter of good family who, with pure intention, has faith in my teaching, whether they have entered the vehicle of the hearers,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la zhugs sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la zhugs sam /
translated: have entered the vehicle of the solitary buddhas,

original: theg pa chen po la zhugs te ngas bstan pa la dad pas khyim nas khyim ma yin par rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par bslab pa'i gnas mang po la shin tu bkur ste dang / ri ma gror bya ba dang / rtsa ba'i sdig pa bzhi bsrung ba la shin tu 'bad pa'i brtson 'grus chen po brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la zhugs te ngas bstan pa la dad pas khyim nas khyim ma yin par rab tu phyung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par bslab pa'i gnas mang po la shin tu bkur ste dang / ri ma gror bya ba dang / rtsa ba'i sdig pa bzhi bsrung ba la shin tu 'bad pa'i brtson 'grus chen po brtsam par bya'o //
translated: or have entered the Great Vehicle, and who, through faith in my teaching, have gone forth from home to homelessness, have received full ordination, and have undertaken with great diligence the practice of the many precepts, the practice of respecting and serving the teacher, and the practice of guarding against the four basic faults,

original: gang zag de la ni rtag tu lha dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa rjes su 'brang zhing srung ste de ni lha dang / mi la sogs pa'i mchod pa'ang chud mi za'o //
analyzed: gang zag de la ni rtag tu lha dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa rjes su 'brang zhing srung ste de ni lha dang / mi la sogs pa'i mchod pa'ang chud mi za'o //
translated: Gods, humans, and non-humans will always follow and protect that person, and the offerings of gods, humans, and so on will not be wasted.

original: theg pa gsum gang la spro zhing dga' ba bzhin de ma thag tu mtha'i gnas byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gang la spro zhing dga' ba bzhin de ma thag tu mtha'i gnas byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will immediately become the final resting place for those who delight in and enjoy the three vehicles.

original: de bas na yang dag pa mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa dag lus dang / srog ston rkyang sla yi /
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa dag lus dang / srog ston rkyang sla yi /
translated: Therefore, those who wish for true nirvāṇa should easily give up their bodies and lives.

original: chos rnam pa de bzhi nyams par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnam pa de bzhi nyams par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not let these four types of Dharma decline.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni rgyu rnam pa 'di gsum gyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bde ba thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni rgyu rnam pa 'di gsum gyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bde ba thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ordinary people attain the happiness of nirvāṇa through these three types of causes.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la brten pa'i rgyu dang / 'phags pas bstan pa la brten pa'i rgyu dang / nga'i nye gnas la brten pa'i rgyu ste gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la brten pa'i rgyu dang / 'phags pas bstan pa la brten pa'i rgyu dang / nga'i nye gnas la brten pa'i rgyu ste gsum mo //
translated: The cause of relying on the Tathāgata, the cause of relying on the teachings of the noble ones, and the cause of relying on my disciples—these are the three.

original: so so'i skye bo dag rgyu rnam pa 'di gsum la brten te btson 'grus su nan tan byas nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bde bar thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag rgyu rnam pa 'di gsum la brten te btson 'grus su nan tan byas nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bde bar thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Ordinary people, on the basis of these three causes, can attain the bliss of nirvāṇa through diligent practice.

original: gang zag gang gis chos rnam pa de bzhi nyams na nga'ang de'i ston pa ma yin la /🔽de'ang nga'i nyan thos @222a *//
analyzed: gang zag gang gis chos rnam pa de bzhi nyams na nga'ang de'i ston pa ma yin la / de'ang nga'i nyan thos @222a *//
translated: If any person were to violate these four dharmas, I would not be his teacher,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: and he would not be my disciple.

original: gang zag gang gis chos rnam pa de bzhin nyams na de ni ngas bstan pa'i shin tu zab pa /
analyzed: gang zag gang gis chos rnam pa de bzhin nyams na de ni ngas bstan pa'i shin tu zab pa /
translated: If any person were to violate these four dharmas, he would violate the very profound,

original: rgya che ba'i mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rgya che ba'i mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa dang ldan pa /
translated: vast, impermanent, suffering, empty, and selfless teachings that I have taught,

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don du 'gyur bar bstan pa so sor thar ba las 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don du 'gyur bar bstan pa so sor thar ba las 'gal ba'o //
translated: which are taught for the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: gal te ngas bstan pa'i so sor thar pa las 'gal na de ni bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad la ldongs shing 'thom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ngas bstan pa'i so sor thar pa las 'gal na de ni bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad la ldongs shing 'thom par 'gyur te /
translated: If one violates the prātimokṣa that I have taught, one will be blind and confused with regard to all meditative concentrations and meditative attainments.

original: gzhol zhing 'jug mi nus pa dang / nyon mongs pa mang pos dkris shing glags te theg pa gsum gyi chos kyi snod kyang ma yin pas ngan song du ltung zhing sdug bsngal chen po myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhol zhing 'jug mi nus pa dang / nyon mongs pa mang pos dkris shing glags te theg pa gsum gyi chos kyi snod kyang ma yin pas ngan song du ltung zhing sdug bsngal chen po myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are unable to incline toward and enter the Dharma, and because they are bound by many afflictions, they are not even vessels for the Dharma of the three vehicles. They will fall into the lower realms and experience great suffering.

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis ngas bstan pa'i so so'i thar pa las rtsa ba bzhi ma nyams te yongs su dag na nga'ang de'i ston pa yin la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis ngas bstan pa'i so so'i thar pa las rtsa ba bzhi ma nyams te yongs su dag na nga'ang de'i ston pa yin la /
translated: if a son or daughter of noble family does not violate the four root precepts in the Pratimokṣa that I have taught and is completely pure, then I am their teacher.

original: de'ang nga'i nyan thos yin pas nga'i gsung gi rjes su 'brang ba /
analyzed: de'ang nga'i nyan thos yin pas nga'i gsung gi rjes su 'brang ba /
translated: They are my śrāvakas, they follow my teachings,

original: nga'i chos la bde bar gnas pa /
analyzed: nga'i chos la bde bar gnas pa /
translated: they abide in my Dharma,

original: bya ba thams cad kyi mthar phyin pa yin pas gang zag de ni tshul khrims kyi phung po la shin tu gnas pas na dge ba'i chos thams cad la legs par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad kyi mthar phyin pa yin pas gang zag de ni tshul khrims kyi phung po la shin tu gnas pas na dge ba'i chos thams cad la legs par gnas pa yin no //
translated: and they have perfected all that needs to be done. Therefore, since that person abides perfectly in the aggregate of morality, they abide well in all virtuous qualities.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa phun sum tshogs pa la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa phun sum tshogs pa la gnas pa yin no //
translated: They abide in the perfection of the vehicle of the śrāvakas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa phun sum tshogs phal gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa phun sum tshogs phal gnas pa yin no //
translated: He is a perfect abode of the vehicle of the Solitary Buddhas.

original: theg pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa la gnas pa yin no //
translated: He is a perfect abode of the Great Vehicle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gal te rang bzhin @222b gyi sdig pa'i rtsa ba rnam pa bzhi po de bsrungs na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin @222b gyi sdig pa'i rtsa ba rnam pa bzhi po de bsrungs na /
translated: If he guards these four basic moral precepts,

original: de ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu mchog dam pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu mchog dam pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: he is established in the supreme cause of all wholesome states, both mundane and supramundane.

original: de bas na chos rnam pa 'di bzhi srung ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos rnam pa 'di bzhi srung ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the guarding of these four basic moral precepts is called the root of all wholesome states.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sa chen po la brten nas rtsi shing dang / lo tog dang / shing gel ba dang / nags tshal la sogs pa thams cad skye'o //
analyzed: sa chen po la brten nas rtsi shing dang / lo tog dang / shing gel ba dang / nags tshal la sogs pa thams cad skye'o //
translated: all trees, crops, vines, and forests grow in dependence on the great earth.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi po 'di srung ba la brten nas dge ba'i chos thams cad 'phel zhing skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi po 'di srung ba la brten nas dge ba'i chos thams cad 'phel zhing skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, all wholesome states grow and increase in dependence on the guarding of these four basic moral precepts.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sa chen po la brten nas ri thams cad dang / ri khor yug dang / ri khong yug chen po dang / ri rab ri'i rgyal po la sogs pa thams cad bde bar gnas so //
analyzed: sa chen po la brten nas ri thams cad dang / ri khor yug dang / ri khong yug chen po dang / ri rab ri'i rgyal po la sogs pa thams cad bde bar gnas so //
translated: In the same way, all the mountains, the Cakravāḍa and Mahācakravāḍa ranges, and Sumeru, the king of mountains, are well established on the great earth.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi po srung ba la brten nas nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / bla na med pa'i theg pa chen po bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi po srung ba la brten nas nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / bla na med pa'i theg pa chen po bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the Śrāvakayāna, the Pratyeka­buddhayāna, and the unsurpassed Mahāyāna are well established on the four roots of morality.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sa chen po la brten nas 'jig rten gyi ro bro ba'i mchog thams cad btsal gyis rnyed do //
analyzed: sa chen po la brten nas 'jig rten gyi ro bro ba'i mchog thams cad btsal gyis rnyed do //
translated: On the great earth, all the best flavors of the world are found.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi po srung ba la brten nas dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang / dang des pa'i bzod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam thams cad dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi po srung ba la brten nas dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang / dang des pa'i bzod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam thams cad dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, on the basis of guarding the four roots of morality, one will attain mindfulness, meditative absorption, dhāraṇī, patient acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena, all the paths of the noble ones, and even unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sa chen po ni gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang ba thams cad snyoms par 'dzin @223a *//
analyzed: sa chen po ni gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang ba thams cad snyoms par 'dzin @223a *//
translated: the great earth is impartial toward all that is clean and unclean.

original: to; ;tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi shin tu srung ba'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo dag kyang de bzhin du chos kyi snod du gyur pa dang / chos kyi snod du ma gyur pa la sems mnyam par bzhag ste de la mi brnyas /
analyzed: to; ;tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi shin tu srung ba'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo dag kyang de bzhin du chos kyi snod du gyur pa dang / chos kyi snod du ma gyur pa la sems mnyam par bzhag ste de la mi brnyas /
translated: In the same way, sons and daughters of good family who guard the four roots of morality will rest evenly in equipoise toward those who are vessels of the Dharma and those who are not vessels of the Dharma. They will not despise them,

original: mi smad / bdag mi bstod /
analyzed: mi smad / bdag mi bstod /
translated: will not disparage them, will not praise themselves,

original: mi snyems / co mi 'dri na dge ba'i chos thams cad skye ba'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi snyems / co mi 'dri na dge ba'i chos thams cad skye ba'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: will not be conceited, and will not be arrogant. They will become a basis for the arising of all virtuous qualities.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sa chen po 'di la ni sems can thams cad de la longs spyod cing bde bar 'tsho'o //
analyzed: sa chen po 'di la ni sems can thams cad de la longs spyod cing bde bar 'tsho'o //
translated: All sentient beings enjoy and live happily on this great earth.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi shin tu srung ba'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa yang dag pa'i chos la shin tu spro ba dang / mchog dam pa'i bsam bdag pas sems can thams cad la bye brag gi 'du shes med par bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi'i chos kyis mnyam par bsdus te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi shin tu srung ba'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa yang dag pa'i chos la shin tu spro ba dang / mchog dam pa'i bsam bdag pas sems can thams cad la bye brag gi 'du shes med par bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi'i chos kyis mnyam par bsdus te /
translated: In the same way, sons and daughters of good family who thoroughly protect the four roots of morality, with the highest, sublime intention, are thoroughly enthusiastic about the Tathāgata’s teaching of the true Dharma, and without any sense of distinction with regard to all sentient beings, gather them through the Dharma of the four ways of gathering.

original: sems can thams cad chos kyi dga' ba la longs spyod cing bde bar 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad chos kyi dga' ba la longs spyod cing bde bar 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: They cause all sentient beings to enjoy the happiness of the Dharma.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa au pa lis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di dag thos nas 'dug pa las langs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa au pa lis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di dag thos nas 'dug pa las langs te /
translated: Then, the venerable Upāli, having heard these words of the Blessed One, rose from his seat,

original: gos tshags bcos nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos gtugs te bla gos phyogs gcig tu byas /
analyzed: gos tshags bcos nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos gtugs te bla gos phyogs gcig tu byas /
translated: arranged his robe over one shoulder, and touching his head to the Blessed One’s feet,

original: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
analyzed: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
translated: He knelt on his right knee, put his palms together, and bowed to the Bhagavān.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He said to the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsungs pa ltar tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi shin tu srung pa'i rigs kyi @223b bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo dag chos kyi snod du gyur pa'i chos kyi snod du ma gyur pa kun la sems mnyam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsungs pa ltar tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi shin tu srung pa'i rigs kyi @223b bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo dag chos kyi snod du gyur pa'i chos kyi snod du ma gyur pa kun la sems mnyam par bzhag ste /
translated: “As the Bhagavān has said, sons and daughters of good family who are very well protected by the four roots of discipline are vessels of the Dharma. They should rest their minds in equipoise on all those who are not vessels of the Dharma.

original: mi brnyas / mi smad /
analyzed: mi brnyas / mi smad /
translated: They should not despise them or disparage them.

original: bdag mi bstod /
analyzed: bdag mi bstod /
translated: They should not praise themselves.

original: mi snyems / glo bur du nyes pa mi gleng ngo zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: mi snyems / glo bur du nyes pa mi gleng ngo zhes gsungs na /
translated: They should not be arrogant. They should not suddenly bring up their faults.

original: de lta na ni ma mchis pa'i dus na dge slong tshul khrims nyams shing mi dge ba spyod pa /
analyzed: de lta na ni ma mchis pa'i dus na dge slong tshul khrims nyams shing mi dge ba spyod pa /
translated: “If that is so, then in the present time there are bhikṣus who have damaged their discipline and engage in nonvirtue.

original: dge sbyong ma lags par dge spyong du khas 'che ba /
analyzed: dge sbyong ma lags par dge spyong du khas 'che ba /
translated: They are not mendicants but claim to be mendicants.

original: tshangs par spyod pa ma lags par tshangs par spyod par khas 'che ba dag la dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis ji lta bu'i thabs kyis gleng zhing dgar bar bgyi /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ma lags par tshangs par spyod par khas 'che ba dag la dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis ji lta bu'i thabs kyis gleng zhing dgar bar bgyi /
translated: How can the saṅgha of bhikṣus debate and argue with those who are not celibate but claim to be celibate?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa au pa li la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa au pa li la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said to the venerable Upāli,

original: ngas mu stegs can dang / khyim pa rnams kyis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng du ni gnang ba'i skabs med do //
analyzed: ngas mu stegs can dang / khyim pa rnams kyis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng du ni gnang ba'i skabs med do //
translated: “I do not allow the tīrthikas and householders to debate the faults of the bhikṣus.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis kyang chos bzhin ma yin pa dang / ma rtogs par tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng du ma gnang na dga' ba'am /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis kyang chos bzhin ma yin pa dang / ma rtogs par tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng du ma gnang na dga' ba'am /
translated: If the saṅgha of bhikṣus does not debate the faults of a bhikṣu who has broken his discipline without proper authorization and understanding, how much less so would they debate and argue with him,

original: bskrad blta ci smos /
analyzed: bskrad blta ci smos /
translated: or even expel him?

original: chos bzhin ma yin pa dang / ma rtogs par tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa glengs sam /
analyzed: chos bzhin ma yin pa dang / ma rtogs par tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa glengs sam /
translated: If they debate the faults of a bhikṣu who has broken his discipline without proper authorization and understanding,

original: gal te bskrad na kha na ma tho ba chen po'i sdig pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: gal te bskrad na kha na ma tho ba chen po'i sdig pa 'thob bo //
translated: or if they expel him, they will incur a great offense.”

original: au pa yi /
analyzed: au pa yi /
translated: Upāli,

original: 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: it should be understood as follows.

original: chos bzhin ma yin pa dang / ma rtogs pa rnam pa 'di bcus tshul khrims nyams ba'i dge slong gi nyes pa glengs na kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa chen po thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chos bzhin ma yin pa dang / ma rtogs pa rnam pa 'di bcus tshul khrims nyams ba'i dge slong gi nyes pa glengs na kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa chen po thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one speaks of the faults of a monk who has violated his ethics for any of these ten reasons, which are not in accord with the Dharma and are not well understood, one will incur a great and grave sin.

original: mkhas ba dag gis ni de ltar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas ba dag gis ni de ltar mi bya'o //
translated: The wise do not act in this way.

original: bcu gang zhe na /🔽dge 'dun ma dad par rgyal po'i spyan sngar ma rtogs @224a *//
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na / dge 'dun ma dad par rgyal po'i spyan sngar ma rtogs @224a *//
translated: What are the ten?🔽Speaking of the faults of a monk who has violated his ethics in the presence of a king, without the Sangha’s approval and without being well understood;

original: bzhin du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / dge 'dun ma dad par kun tu rgyu ba'i mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / dge 'dun ma dad par blon po'i mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang /
analyzed: bzhin du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / dge 'dun ma dad par kun tu rgyu ba'i mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / dge 'dun ma dad par blon po'i mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang /
translated: speaking of the faults of a monk who has violated his ethics in the presence of a wandering ascetic, without the Sangha’s approval; speaking of the faults of a monk who has violated his ethics in the presence of a minister, without the Sangha’s approval;

original: dge 'dun ma dad par tshong dpon dang / khyim bdag gi mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / bud med mang po'i mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / skyes pa mang po'i mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang /
analyzed: dge 'dun ma dad par tshong dpon dang / khyim bdag gi mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / bud med mang po'i mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / skyes pa mang po'i mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang /
translated: To speak of the faults of a monk who has broken his vows in front of a merchant or a householder when the members of the Sangha are not present;🔽to speak of the faults of a monk who has broken his vows in front of many women; to speak of the faults of a monk who has broken his vows in front of many men;🔽to speak of the faults of a monk who has broken his vows in front of many people who are hostile to the teachings; to speak of the faults of a monk who has broken his vows in front of many monks and nuns;

original: ma rung bar byed pa mang po'i mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma mang po'i mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / 'khon yod pa'i mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang /
analyzed: ma rung bar byed pa mang po'i mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma mang po'i mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / 'khon yod pa'i mdun du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang /
translated: to speak of the faults of a monk who has broken his vows in front of people who have a grudge against him;

original: dgra bo zhe 'gras pa'i mdun du ma rtogs bzhin du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba'o //
analyzed: dgra bo zhe 'gras pa'i mdun du ma rtogs bzhin du tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba'o //
translated: to speak of the faults of a monk who has broken his vows in front of enemies who hate him without first investigating the matter.

original: 'di dag ni chos ma yin pa dang / ma rtogs par tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng na kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa chen po thob par 'gyur ba bcu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni chos ma yin pa dang / ma rtogs par tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes pa gleng na kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa chen po thob par 'gyur ba bcu zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the ten grave offenses that one commits when one falsely accuses a monk who has violated the precepts of a grave offense.

original: gal te bden pa yang dag pa la brten te glengs na'ang nyes par 'gyur na bden pa ma yin pa la brten te gleng ba lta ci smos @224b te; kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bden pa yang dag pa la brten te glengs na'ang nyes par 'gyur na bden pa ma yin pa la brten te gleng ba lta ci smos @224b te; kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one commits a grave offense by falsely accusing someone of a grave offense, what need is there to mention the grave offenses one commits by falsely accusing someone of a grave offense?

original: gzhan yang / chos ma yin pa rnam pa 'di bcus tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes ba glengs na kha na ma tho ba chen po'i sdig pa 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos ma yin pa rnam pa 'di bcus tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi nyes ba glengs na kha na ma tho ba chen po'i sdig pa 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: “Moreover, if one falsely accuses a monk who has violated the precepts of a grave offense, one commits a grave offense.

original: mkhas pa dag gis de ltar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag gis de ltar mi bya'o //
translated: The wise do not do this.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: mu stegs can dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / tshul khrims med pa'i khyim bdag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / mtshams med pa byas pa dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / dam pa'i chos la skur pa dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang /
analyzed: mu stegs can dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / tshul khrims med pa'i khyim bdag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / mtshams med pa byas pa dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / dam pa'i chos la skur pa dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang /
translated: the faults of a monk being discussed by tīrthikas, the faults of a monk being discussed by householders who have no ethical discipline, the faults of a monk being discussed by those who have committed heinous actions, the faults of a monk being discussed by those who have denigrated the sublime teaching,

original: 'phags pa rnams la smod pa dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / glen pa sems 'khrug pa dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / nad kyis yongs su gzir ba dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la smod pa dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / glen pa sems 'khrug pa dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / nad kyis yongs su gzir ba dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang /
translated: the faults of a monk being discussed by those who revile the noble ones, the faults of a monk being discussed by those who are stupid and mentally disturbed, the faults of a monk being discussed by those who are afflicted by illness,

original: phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi rung bar byed pa bas dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / bza' shing gi ra ba srung ba dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / dge slong chad pa ba dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba ste /
analyzed: phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi rung bar byed pa bas dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / bza' shing gi ra ba srung ba dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba dang / dge slong chad pa ba dag gis dge slong gi nyes pa gleng ba ste /
translated: to speak of the faults of a monk who is a caretaker of the Sangha’s property for the sick;🔽to speak of the faults of a monk who is a caretaker of the Sangha’s medicine.

original: chos ma yin pa rnam pa 'di bcus dge slong tshul khrims nyams pa'i nyes pa glengs na kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa rnam pa 'di bcus dge slong tshul khrims nyams pa'i nyes pa glengs na kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Upāli, if a monk speaks of the faults of a monk whose conduct is impaired in these ten ways, he will incur a serious misdeed.

original: ji ste bden pa yang dag pa la brten te glengs na'ang nyes par 'gyur na bden pa ma yin par gleng ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: ji ste bden pa yang dag pa la brten te glengs na'ang nyes par 'gyur na bden pa ma yin par gleng ba lta ci smos te /
translated: If he speaks of the faults of a monk who is pure in his conduct, he will incur a serious misdeed even if he speaks the truth.

original: kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he speaks falsely, he will incur a serious misdeed.

original: gzhan yang / au pa li /🔽gal te dge slong @225a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang / au pa li / gal te dge slong @225a *//
translated: “Upāli,🔽if a monk whose conduct is impaired

original: tshul khrims nyams pa dag dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi nang na dge 'dun dang lhan cig tu gnas na /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa dag dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi nang na dge 'dun dang lhan cig tu gnas na /
translated: lives together with the Sangha of monks in the midst of the Sangha,

original: dge slong de'i nang na tshul bzhin du byed pa /
analyzed: dge slong de'i nang na tshul bzhin du byed pa /
translated: Among the monks there was one who was acting in accordance with the Dharma,

original: spyod lam dang ldan pa /
analyzed: spyod lam dang ldan pa /
translated: who was endowed with good conduct,

original: yon tan lnga phrugs dang ldan pa gcig 'dug pa las langs te /
analyzed: yon tan lnga phrugs dang ldan pa gcig 'dug pa las langs te /
translated: and who was endowed with the five qualities.🔽He rose from his seat, arranged his robes, and with respect he bowed down at the feet of the saṅgha of monks.

original: gos tshags bcos la ba sti stang dang bcas pas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi rkang pa la phyag 'tshal la; de nas tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi mdun du song la nyes pa gleng ngo zhes 'di skad gsol ba thob cig /
analyzed: gos tshags bcos la ba sti stang dang bcas pas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi rkang pa la phyag 'tshal la; de nas tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi mdun du song la nyes pa gleng ngo zhes 'di skad gsol ba thob cig /
translated: Then he should go in front of the monk who has broken his discipline and say, ‘Please make this request:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs shig /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs shig /
translated: “Venerable, please listen!

original: bdag deng tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyis nyes pa gleng ngo //
analyzed: bdag deng tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyis nyes pa gleng ngo //
translated: Today I will speak about your faults.

original: bden pa / rdzun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: bden pa / rdzun pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is true, not false.

original: dus la bab pa /
analyzed: dus la bab pa /
translated: It is timely,

original: dus las mi 'da' ba /
analyzed: dus las mi 'da' ba /
translated: not untimely.

original: 'dzum bzhin du smra ba /
analyzed: 'dzum bzhin du smra ba /
translated: I will speak with a smiling face,

original: mi brlang ba'i tshig dang / byams pa'i sems dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / phan pa dang / bde ba'i gnod pa ma yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mig dang / chos kyi sgron ma yun du gnas par bya ba'i phyir gleng ngo //
analyzed: mi brlang ba'i tshig dang / byams pa'i sems dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / phan pa dang / bde ba'i gnod pa ma yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mig dang / chos kyi sgron ma yun du gnas par bya ba'i phyir gleng ngo //
translated: with words that are not harsh, with a loving mind, without anger, with benefit, with happiness, without harm, and for the sake of establishing the eye of the Dharma of the Tathāgatas and the lamp of the Dharma.

original: tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: Venerable one,

original: khyod kyi nyes pa bdag gis chos bzhin du gleng ngo zhes gsol ba thob cig /
analyzed: khyod kyi nyes pa bdag gis chos bzhin du gleng ngo zhes gsol ba thob cig /
translated: you should request, 'I will speak to you about your faults in accordance with the Dharma.'

original: gang zag des gleng du gnang na ni chos bzhin du gleng bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag des gleng du gnang na ni chos bzhin du gleng bar bya'o //
translated: If that person gives permission to speak, then speak in accordance with the Dharma.

original: gal te gleng du ma gnang na phyir yang gnas brtan dang / dge 'dun gyi rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te bsti stang dang bcas bas 'di skad ces gsol cig /
analyzed: gal te gleng du ma gnang na phyir yang gnas brtan dang / dge 'dun gyi rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te bsti stang dang bcas bas 'di skad ces gsol cig /
translated: If they do not give permission to speak, then again bow to the feet of the elder and the Saṅgha, and with respect say this:

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba nyes pa 'di lta bu zhig bgyis te /
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba nyes pa 'di lta bu zhig bgyis te /
translated: 'The monk named so-and-so has committed such-and-such a fault.

original: bdag gis chos lnga la @225b brten te gleng bar 'tshal lo zhes gsol cig /
analyzed: bdag gis chos lnga la @225b brten te gleng bar 'tshal lo zhes gsol cig /
translated: I will speak to him based on the five dharmas.'

original: de nas dge 'dun gyi nang ngan dge slong gnas brtan gyis shin tu rtogs la gleng pa bas ci gleng ba dang / nyes pa ci byas pa dang / bden nam /
analyzed: de nas dge 'dun gyi nang ngan dge slong gnas brtan gyis shin tu rtogs la gleng pa bas ci gleng ba dang / nyes pa ci byas pa dang / bden nam /
translated: Then, the elder monks in the community should question the accused very thoroughly. They should ask what was said, what misdeed was done, and whether it was true or false.

original: rdzun nam / lci'am /
analyzed: rdzun nam / lci'am /
translated: They should ask whether the offense was serious or minor.

original: yang brtogs la 'dul ba dang / mdo sde la brten te bsdigs pa dang / bzho ba'i thabs sna tshogs kyis dri zhing gleng bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang brtogs la 'dul ba dang / mdo sde la brten te bsdigs pa dang / bzho ba'i thabs sna tshogs kyis dri zhing gleng bar bya'o //
translated: They should question and accuse him by various means, such as relying on the Vinaya and the sūtras, and by the methods of reprimand and reproach.

original: bdun shin tu zhi bar bya ba'i chos kyis gang dang / gang du mthun pa de dang / de'i chos kyis zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdun shin tu zhi bar bya ba'i chos kyis gang dang / gang du mthun pa de dang / de'i chos kyis zhi bar bya'o //
translated: If there is agreement between the accused and the accuser, then the matter should be settled according to the Dharma.

original: gal te nyes pa chen po byas na'ang chad pa chen pos gcad do //
analyzed: gal te nyes pa chen po byas na'ang chad pa chen pos gcad do //
translated: If a serious offense was committed, then a serious penalty should be imposed.

original: nyes pa 'bring byas na'ang chad pa 'bring gis gcad do //
analyzed: nyes pa 'bring byas na'ang chad pa 'bring gis gcad do //
translated: If a middling offense was committed, then a middling penalty should be imposed.

original: nyes pa chung ngu byas na'ang chad pa chung ngus gcad de khrel pa dang / ngo tsha bas nyes pa mthol du gzhug go /
analyzed: nyes pa chung ngu byas na'ang chad pa chung ngus gcad de khrel pa dang / ngo tsha bas nyes pa mthol du gzhug go /
translated: If a minor offense was committed, then a minor penalty should be imposed. The accused should be made to confess his offense with shame and embarrassment.

original: de nas au pa lis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas au pa lis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Upāli again asked the Blessed One,🔽“Blessed One, if a monk commits a serious offense, what should be done?”

original: nyes pa yang dag par byung ba'i sdig pa bgyis pa'i dge slong dag gal te khyim pa'i mthu las snyems sam /
analyzed: nyes pa yang dag par byung ba'i sdig pa bgyis pa'i dge slong dag gal te khyim pa'i mthu las snyems sam /
translated: If a monk who has committed a sin that has arisen from a fault, should he be arrogant because of the power of a layperson,

original: nor gyi mthu snyems sam /
analyzed: nor gyi mthu snyems sam /
translated: or because of the power of wealth,

original: mang du thos pa'i mthu dang / smra bshags kyi mthu dang / slob ma'i mthu la snyems te /
analyzed: mang du thos pa'i mthu dang / smra bshags kyi mthu dang / slob ma'i mthu la snyems te /
translated: or because of the power of being learned, or because of the power of eloquence, or because of the power of disciples,

original: mthu rnam pa de lta bus mjid bsdoms te /
analyzed: mthu rnam pa de lta bus mjid bsdoms te /
translated: and with such power should he be obstinate,

original: de dge 'dun gyi ngag mi nyan la dge slong gnas brtan mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo 'dzin pas chos bzhin du bstan cing bcos kyang nyan du mi btub pa'i dge slong de la ji ltar chad pas gcad par bgyi /
analyzed: de dge 'dun gyi ngag mi nyan la dge slong gnas brtan mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo 'dzin pas chos bzhin du bstan cing bcos kyang nyan du mi btub pa'i dge slong de la ji ltar chad pas gcad par bgyi /
translated: and if that monk does not listen to the Saṅgha and is not subdued by the elder monks who uphold the sūtras, the vinaya, and the mātṛkā, and if he is not subdued by the teaching and correction in accordance with the Dharma, how should he be punished?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong gnas brtan sde snod gsum 'dzin @226a *//
analyzed: dge slong gnas brtan sde snod gsum 'dzin @226a *//
translated: “The elder monks who uphold the Tripiṭaka

original: pas dge 'dun la dad pa dris te /
analyzed: pas dge 'dun la dad pa dris te /
translated: should ask the Saṅgha about their faith.

original: rgyal po dang / blon po chen po la mthu btsal ba'i pho nya thong la gdod chos bzhin du chad pas chod cig /
analyzed: rgyal po dang / blon po chen po la mthu btsal ba'i pho nya thong la gdod chos bzhin du chad pas chod cig /
translated: They should send a messenger to seek the power of the king and the great ministers, and then punish them in accordance with the Dharma.”

original: au pa lis yang gsol pa /
analyzed: au pa lis yang gsol pa /
translated: Upāli asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: gal te sdig pa bgyis pa'i dge slong de nor dbyig gi mthu dang / mang du thos pa'i mthu dang / smra bshags kyi mthu dang / thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rgyal po dang / blon po'ang dga' bar bgyis te /
analyzed: gal te sdig pa bgyis pa'i dge slong de nor dbyig gi mthu dang / mang du thos pa'i mthu dang / smra bshags kyi mthu dang / thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rgyal po dang / blon po'ang dga' bar bgyis te /
translated: if that monk who has committed a sin, through the power of his wealth, the power of his learning, the power of his eloquence, and through various means, delights the king and ministers,

original: thams cad chos ma lags par bgyis pa /
analyzed: thams cad chos ma lags par bgyis pa /
translated: and makes everything non-dharma,

original: tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi grogs bgyid de /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa'i dge slong gi grogs bgyid de /
translated: and becomes an ally of monks who have violated their vows,

original: tshul khrims ngan pa tsam gyi dge slong de dag sdig pa nyam rangs su bgyid du stsal nas chos bzhin du chad pas gcad du'ang mi ster na /
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa tsam gyi dge slong de dag sdig pa nyam rangs su bgyid du stsal nas chos bzhin du chad pas gcad du'ang mi ster na /
translated: and allows those monks who are merely of bad character to commit sins at will, and does not even allow them to be punished in accordance with the Dharma,

original: de'i tshe de la dge 'dun gyis ji ltar bgyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe de la dge 'dun gyis ji ltar bgyi /
translated: what should the Saṅgha do to him at that time?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis au pa li la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis au pa li la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said to Upāli,

original: gal te dge slong de mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba la brten te /
analyzed: gal te dge slong de mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba la brten te /
translated: If that monk, relying on non-abiding and non-action,

original: dge 'dun gyi nang du gnas nas sdig pa chen po mngon sum du mi snang na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang du gnas nas sdig pa chen po mngon sum du mi snang na /
translated: dwells within the Saṅgha and does not manifest great sins,🔽then the Saṅgha should expel him.

original: de'i tshe dge 'dun gyis skad cig gzhag go /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge 'dun gyis skad cig gzhag go /
translated: At that time, the Saṅgha should suspend him.

original: gal te dge slong de mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba'i sdig pa chen po mngon sum du snang bzhin du dge 'dun gyi nang na gnas na /
analyzed: gal te dge slong de mi gnas pa dang / mi bya ba'i sdig pa chen po mngon sum du snang bzhin du dge 'dun gyi nang na gnas na /
translated: If that monk, while still committing the great sin of not abiding and not doing what should be done, remains in the Saṅgha,
